title: Dispatch Specialist
description:
We are seeking for a Specialist, Dispatch in the Property Care / Field Service industry.



We are looking for someone who is highly organized and great at planning routes and schedules. In simple terms — you will make sure our field crews know where to go, when to go there, and have everything they need before they leave.



If you enjoy solving puzzles, organizing schedules, working with maps, and making operations run smoothly, this role is for you.



What You’ll Really Be Doing:

Plan and organize daily and weekly schedules for multiple markets.

Group jobs by area to reduce travel time and increase productivity.

Make sure every job ticket has the correct address, clear instructions, and complete details before assigning it.

Upload important information (gate codes, site maps, permits) so crews don’t waste trips.

Adjust schedules quickly when there are call-outs, weather issues, or urgent jobs.

Monitor GPS and gas usage to ensure routes are efficient and no resources are being misused.

Keep teams accountable for following proper processes.



What We’re Really Looking For:

At least 5 years of experience in dispatching, logistics, or fleet coordination.

Experience in field service, construction, transportation, or similar industries.

Someone who thinks logically and can visualize routes on a map.

Comfortable managing a high volume of schedules across different locations and time zones.

Tech-savvy and experienced with scheduling or field service software.

Confident communicator who can enforce rules and keep teams aligned.

Calm under pressure and able to adjust plans quickly.



What Success Looks Like:

Crews spend most of their day working — not driving.

Fewer job failures due to missing information.

Quick response to urgent schedule changes.

Improved fuel efficiency and route optimization.



Requirements:

Updated Resume/CV.

Reliable internet connection and personal computer.

UPS/battery backup for power interruptions.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.



Benefits:

Competitive salary.

Performance-based incentives.

PTO and paid holidays.

Remote work flexibility.

Opportunity to grow in a high-performance environment.

HMO for you and your dependents.



Join our team now and be part of the top 1% talent in the Philippines!

title: CRM Architect & Automation Specialist
description:
Construction | Project-Based | Dual Business Units 

Remote | Fixed Fee Only 



We are implementing a structured CRM to support two related but distinct business units within the construction sector. 



The system will operate under one CRM environment with: 



• Two clearly separated business units 

• Independent pipelines 

• Shared executive reporting 

• Automation-driven workflows 



We are not looking for high-level advice. 

We require precise implementation of a defined operating model. 



This is a fixed-scope, fixed-fee engagement. 



 



Scope Overview 



The CRM must support: 



Business Unit A – Residential Builder Operations 



• Lead intake and sales pipeline 

• Pre-construction tracking 

• Construction stage tracking 

• Revenue forecasting 

• Project pipeline visibility 



Business Unit B – Estimating & Advisory Services 



• Builder lead qualification 

• Estimating workflow management 

• RFQ tracking per project 

• Trade response monitoring 

• Turnaround tracking 

• Fee and invoice status tracking 



Executive Layer 



• Business Unit filtering 

• Combined and segmented dashboards 

• Pipeline value reporting 

• Conversion metrics 

• Performance tracking 

• Revenue forecasting 



The system must be scalable, segmented, and cleanly structured. 



 



What You Will Do 



• Review structured workflow requirements 

• Recommend the most suitable platform (HubSpot, Zoho, or equivalent) 

• Architect dual business unit CRM structure 

• Build pipelines, custom fields, automation, and dashboards 

• Configure role-based access 

• Deliver documentation and handover training 



Fixed price only. No hourly billing.

title: Finance & Accounting Expert for Digital Agency & holding companies
description:
Role Overview

Our Finance & Accounting Specialist is responsible for ensuring financial clarity, compliance, and operational efficiency across all Ecubate companies.



This role covers the day-to-day financial workflows — from bookkeeping to maintaining dashboards, improving SOPs, and proactively flagging risks or opportunities.



The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, systems-driven, and proactive, ensuring the finance function runs smoothly with minimal oversight.



Key Responsibilities



Financial Management & Reporting

- Maintain and update the Google Sheets Financial Dashboard monthly.

- Track and report on key metrics: cashflow, revenue, profitability, and runway.

- Provide weekly summaries to founders with insights, risks, and action steps.



Bookkeeping

- Process and reconcile entries in Moneybird software (invoices, receipts, bank transactions).

- Ensure all records are accurate, categorised, and audit-ready.



Systems & SOP Management

- Identify inefficiencies create and optimise financial SOPs.

- Automate recurring tasks using tools like Zapier or Make.



Collaboration

- Coordinate with external accountants/bookkeepers when necessary.

- Support the founders with holding company finances.

- Assist in preparing financial information for strategic decisions.



KPIs for Success



- **Data Accuracy:** All financial data is accurate, reconciled, and up to date.

- **Reporting Timeliness:** Weekly reports delivered on schedule.

- **Process Reliability:** SOPs are followed and regularly improved.

- **Proactive Risk Management:** Potential issues flagged before they escalate.

- **Efficiency Gains:** Demonstrable improvements in finance workflows and automation.



Skills & Requirements



- Proven experience in finance, accounting, and bookkeeping.

- Strong understanding of digital business models (agencies, ecommerce, SaaS).

- Proficiency in Moneybird, Google Sheets, and Notion.

- Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to self-manage.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

- Comfortable handling confidential financial data.

- Willingness to learn new regulations and tools quickly.

Bonus Skills

- Familiarity with Dutch VAT and SME finance structures.

- Experience with financial automation tools (Zapier, Make, advanced Sheets formulas).

- Passion for building systems, processes, and documentation.



Performance Review Structure



Quarterly Review will cover:

1. Accuracy and timeliness of reporting.

2. Quality and clarity of weekly financial summaries.

3. Adherence to and improvement of SOPs.

4. Proactivity in identifying risks and opportunities.

5. Impact of workflow automation and efficiency gains.



To apply please provide your CV and write a motivation why you are a fit for Ecubate. Please also provide us with your LinkedIn and WhatsApp.

title: Maintenance & Repairs Coordinator
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)

Working Hours: UK business hours (with some flexibility)

Company: Block & Estate Management Company (UK Property Sector)



About Us



We are a UK-based block and estate management company responsible for managing residential developments and delivering efficient, responsive maintenance and repairs services to our clients. We are expanding our operations team and are looking for a highly organised, proactive Maintenance & Repairs Coordinator to support our UK portfolio remotely.



The Role



You will be responsible for managing day-to-day maintenance and repair issues across multiple residential blocks, ensuring jobs are logged, contractors are instructed, quotes are obtained, and works are completed within agreed timeframes.



You will be the central point of coordination between residents, contractors, and our internal team, ensuring excellent communication and accurate record-keeping at all times. 



Maint & Repair - Manual



Key Responsibilities

Issue Management



Receive maintenance requests via phone and



Gather all required information from residents (contact details, issue description, access details, photos where needed)



Log all issues accurately on our 
 system



Ensure all data fields are completed for tracking and reporting



Contractor Coordination



Allocate jobs to appropriate contractors based on trade and location



Call contractors to confirm availability and attendance times



Issue formal work orders using company templates



Ensure emergency works are attended same day and routine works within agreed SLAs



Quotes & Client Approval



Request and manage contractor quotations for larger works



Obtain multiple quotes where required



Prepare and send approval
s to client directors



Track approvals and place orders once authorised



Job Tracking & Completion



Monitor job progress and chase contractors for updates



Confirm completion of works



Obtain job reports, photos, and compliant invoices



Upload documentation to the system and update job status



Communication



Provide clear updates to residents on contractor appointments



Maintain professional written and spoken communication in English



Ensure all correspondence follows company templates and standards



Requirements

Essential



Excellent spoken and written English



Previous experience in property maintenance coordination, facilities management, helpdesk, or similar role



Strong administrative and organisational skills



Experience using task management systems (
, Asana, Trello, or similar)



Confident making outbound calls to contractors and residents



Ability to manage multiple jobs and prioritise emergencies



High attention to detail and process compliance



Reliable internet connection and quiet working environment



Desirable



Experience working with UK property or block management companies



Knowledge of maintenance trades (plumbing, electrical, roofing, locksmith, etc.)



Experience handling quotations and contractor invoices



KPIs / Performance Measures



Accurate logging of all maintenance issues



Contractor response times met



Jobs completed within target timeframes



Complete and compliant documentation on all jobs



Clear and professional communication with stakeholders



What We Offer



Long-term remote role with a growing UK company



Structured processes and full training provided



Supportive team environment



Opportunity to take ownership of a critical operational function



How to Apply



Please submit:



Your CV



A short cover letter outlining your experience in maintenance coordination or property management



Confirmation you can work UK hours

title: Customer Support Specialist and Sales Support
description:
Overview

Product Management Accelerator (PMA) helps ambitious professionals pivot their careers into digital product management roles and grow as product leaders at leading tech companies such as FAANG companies and startup unicorns through Dr. Nancy Li’s PROFIT framework, as featured in Forbes. Our graduates accelerate their careers, make an impact, and negotiate a top salary.



We’re one of the fastest-growing companies in the product management space and are looking for a Customer Success Specialist to ensure customer satisfaction and build our alumni community to help us make the product management field accessible to all.



About the Role

As a Customer Support Representative and Sales Support, you will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service to our clients and supporting our sales team. You will be the first point of contact for our customers, ensuring that their needs are met and providing solutions to their concerns.



Key responsibilities include:

- Identify and connect with potential customers through customized messages using
, LinkedIn, Instagram, and other platforms.

- Respond to customer inquiries via phone,
, chat, or other communication channels.

- Make phone calls or Zoom calls with students or prospective students to understand their needs and study progress, and collect student feedback.

- Provide product and service information to customers and identify upselling opportunities.

- Resolve escalated or complex calls from customers with professionalism and patience.

- Conduct online community management, including facilitating engagements, creating community events, and answering questions

- Proactively monitor performance metrics 

- Create and manage online and offline events through Meetup, LinkedIn Events, Eventbrite

- Communicate with event attendees and manage event logistics



Other Activities

Collaboration with the team when necessary 

Attend tea
etings for updates

Other activities assigned by the company as needed



Requirements:

Very fluent in English

Able to speak on the phone with students or prospective students for about 3 hours per day.

Bachelor's degree preferred.

Minimum of 2 years of experience in Customer Support or a related field.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to handle complex customer situations with empathy and understanding.

Proficient in using computer systems and customer relationship management 

Respond to customer inquiries in a timely manner, such as within 10 minutes or a reasonable time frame during normal business hours.

Respond to urgent customer requests during the weekends if urgent matters occur.

Proactive and able to work independently as well as part of a team.

Work hours: Monday to Friday 9am to 12:30pm EST and 8:30pm-12am EST, (7 hours/day) and 5 hours during the weekend, total of 40 hours/week, Or nightshift from 9:30am EST to 6pm EST (7.5 hours/day) with one hour break/rest in the middle and 2.5 hours during the weekend. Total 40 hours/week. Subject to change based on team needs



This is a full-time job. If you have other full-time or part-time jobs, please DON’T apply. 





Company Culture 

At PM Accelerator, we value a growth mindset, community service, and efficiency. We inspire and train each of our tea
mbers to quickly become masters and leaders of their discipline and accelerate their personal and professional growth. 



PM Accelerator donates a percentage of our earnings to educational nonprofits providing entrepreneurship and mentorship to children from underserved communities. We encourage each tea
mber to give back to their communities and make an impact. 



Watch the 2min Forbes interview to learn about the company culture:







Benefits:

Competitive pay and performance-based incentives, such as sales commission.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Access to community/company training programs





How To Apply

Submit your resume through the job board where we post this JD. DON’T
 us your application; it will get lost. We review all the applications within 24 business hours.

Why do you want to work for PMA and why are you the right fit for this role

All applicants will receive a take-home exam to assess your skills

title: Remote Lead Generation Specialist
description:
We’re looking for a motivated and results-driven Lead Generation Specialist to help grow our sales pipeline and expand our customer base. As a BDR, you’ll be on the front lines of our sales efforts, identifying potential clients, generating leads, and nurturing opportunities to connect them with our solutions.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Proactively research and identify potential customers in target markets.

2. Reach out to prospects via
s, LinkedIn, and other communication channels.

3. Qualify leads to assess fit and interest, ensuring alignment with our services.

4. Schedule meetings or product demos between qualified leads and Sales Development Representatives.

5. Maintain accurate records of lead interactions and update CRM systems accordingly.

6. Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to execute campaigns and optimize lead generation strategies.

7. Stay up-to-date on industry trends and our product/service offerings to effectively communicate value propositions.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

- 2 - 3 years of experience in sales, business development, or a similar role (entry-level candidates with strong communication skills and a hunger to learn are also encouraged to apply).

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport quickly.

- Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and eager to exceed targets.

- Proficiency in extracting data from LinkedIn Sales Navigator and other professional networks

- Must have a well-optimized LinkedIn account with atleast a minimum of 300 connections that can be used for prospecting

- Familiarity with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, PipeDrive) is a plus.

- Comfortable with cold outreach and prospecting.



Who we are:

Acadium started with the belief that anyone, anywhere, should be able to get the skills and experience they need to start their career without barriers like price, schedule, or location getting in their way. Acadium gives anyone the tools, support, and mentorship they need to launch their dream career. Acadium is the only platform that provides real work experience, accessible to everyone. Acadium began in 2017 with a team of 3 co-founders: Richard Shaw, Marco Tundo, and Moe Abbas. Since then, they’ve attracted more than 120,000 student members and over 50,000 businesses to connect through the apprenticeship marketplace. Our team is growing and looking for people who are motivated, intelligent, and committed to making education accessible to join our team.



What we value:

Integrity - Be trustworthy in your actions

Care - Treat your teammates and our community as you would want to be treated

Curiosity - Ask questions. Always state your assumptions

Tenacity - Persevere when times are tough

Discipline - Be consistent in your actions

Ambition - Aspire to become better every day

Service -Serve your community to the best of your abilities.



Interested applicants may send updated CVs and LinkedIn URLs with a minimum of 300 connections to 

 Subject: [Adjective that describes you] B2B Lead Generation Specialist

**Note: Only applicants who submit their resumes and LinkedIn URL will be evaluated.

title: Executive Assistant & Customer Support Manager (Full-Time | Remote)
description:
Executive Assistant & Customer Support Manager (Full-Time | Remote)

Are you a proactive, detail-obsessed, high-performance Executive Assistant looking for a role that challenges you, excites you, and gives you room to grow?



Are you someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, loves supporting high-level CEOs, and takes pride in keeping things organized, streamlined, and running like clockwork?



If yes, keep reading.



I am the CEO of two successful holistic businesses, a homeschooling mother of four, and a visionary entrepreneur scaling to $10M+. I have ZERO time for micromanaging—I need a sharp, proactive, and highly skilled EA to own this role and anticipate my needs.



WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

Executive Assistance (60%)

- Take my voice messages and turn them into
s, content scripts, SOPs, and documents

- Manage my inbox & calendar – Ensure every meeting, deadline, and follow-up is handled

- Schedule personal & professional appointments – From business meetings to massages

- Create, update & manage SOPs – Keep all business processes clear and documented

- Track and report key business KPIs – Keep me informed of critical metrics

- Project management & delegation – Assign, follow up, and ensure execution across teams

- Team communication – Act as my right hand, keeping my team aligned and efficient

- Support launch & funnel execution – Assist with digital product launches and campaigns



Customer Support & Operations (40%)

- Handle customer service with excellence – Ensure every customer feels valued and supported

- Manage customer onboarding & success – Ensure seamless client experiences

- Process refunds & orders efficiently – Handle Shopify & course platform admin

- Support affiliate & brand ambassador programs – Assist with partnerships and collaborations

- Troubleshoot tech issues for customers – Assist with logins, course access, and product questions



WHO YOU ARE:

- Hyper-organized & detail-oriented – You love checklists, efficiency, and keeping things streamlined

- Proactive problem-solver – You don’t wait for instructions. You see an issue and fix it. You know the secret word is Honey

- A skilled communicator – Your written & spoken English is excellent, and you can communicate clearly

- Tech-savvy & resourceful – You can figure out new tools and software without needing step-by-step guidance

- Fast-paced & unshakable – You handle a high-energy work environment with confidence and calm

- Loyal & discreet – You handle confidential information with professionalism & trustworthiness

-Mission-aligned – You’re excited about holistic health & wellness



REQUIREMENTS:

- 2+ years experience as an EA, OBM, or high-level virtual assistant

- Fluent in English (spoken & written)

- Experience in customer support & client success

- Familiar with Asana, ClickUp, Airtable, Shopify, ConvertKit, or willing to learn

- Able to work during core U.S. business hours



COMPENSATION & PERKS:

- Competitive salary – Based on experience

- Bonuses & growth opportunities – Hard work is rewarded

- Flexible remote work – As long as you get things done

- Career development – Room to grow into OBM or Director of Operations



HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY!)

1. Fill out this full application: 

2. Send a message via OnlineJobs.ph with:



Why you’re the best fit



Your expected salary (USD)



The secret word in the subject line 



A fun fact about you



DO NOT
 my company. Applications missing the secret word will be ignored.



Hiring for an April-May Start Date

This is a high-level, high-impact role. If you're a superstar, I want you. Apply now!

title: Billing/AR Specialist
description:
Billing/AR Specialist - Ally Logistics



ABOUT ALLY LOGISTICS:

Ally Logistics is a U.S.-based third-party logistics (3PL) company headquartered in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Since 2012, we’ve been committed to creating the ultimate freight shipping experience by operating at the optimal intersection of people and technology. As a full-service 3PL, we specialize in a wide range of freight solutions, including dry van, refrigerated, drayage, straight truck, open deck/flatbed, drop-trailer programs, warehousing, and more. Our diverse service capabilities allow us to support shippers across industries with flexible, reliable, and scalable logistics strategies.

We partner with skilled global talent to support our continued growth and operational excellence, ensuring our customers receive efficient, high-quality service at every step of the supply chain.





ROLE SUMMARY:

The Billing/AR Specialist is responsible for accurate execution of billing, collections, and cash application tasks, as well as timely resolution of exceptions, to ensure financial operations run smoothly. The role includes processing customer invoices in accordance with customer requirements, verifying carrier payment information, applying customer payments accurately, and resolving payment issues promptly with both internal and external teams. The position requires strong attention to detail, effective problem-solving skills, and meticulous exception management.



Regular Weekly Schedule (40 hours): Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time with 1-hour unpaid lunch break from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Eastern. Overtime (40+ hours) requires manager approval.



JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: 

-Process carrier paperwork and billing via Triumphpay/Revenova; ensuring accuracy and compliance with customer requirements 

-Apply customer payments accurately

-Timely resolution of unidentified payments and customer payment discrepancies

-Responsible for on-time payment collection from assigned customers



COMPENSATION:

Compensation will be determined based on experience. All payments are issued in USD via Wise.



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

-Minimum of 2 years of experience in logistics/3PL industry

-Minimum of 2 years of Billing/AR experience, preferably within the logistics/3PL industry

-Strong written and verbal English communication skills

-Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

-Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

-High attention to detail and accuracy

-Exceptional organizational and time management skills 



Access to:

-A reliable computer with high-speed internet (Backup internet source (mobile hotspot or secondary line preferred)

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

-Headset

-Professional remote workspace

-Ability to work U.S. business hours (EST)



Experience with:

-Outlook

-Zoom phone

-Slack

-Basic CRM or logistics platform



Additional Requirements

1. Technology & Equipment Requirements

-Reliable high-speed internet and computer

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

-Quiet, professional workspace



2. Availability Requirements

-Ability to work U.S. Eastern Time

-Must provide advanced notice for planned time off

-Must maintain consistent communication (Slack responsiveness,
, etc.)

title: Junior Spot Market Pricing & Bidding Analyst
description:
Junior Spot Market Pricing & Bidding Analyst  - Ally Logistics



ABOUT ALLY LOGISTICS:

Ally Logistics is a U.S.-based third-party logistics (3PL) company headquartered in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Since 2012, we’ve been committed to creating the ultimate freight shipping experience by operating at the optimal intersection of people and technology. As a full-service 3PL, we specialize in a wide range of freight solutions, including dry van, refrigerated, drayage, straight truck, open deck/flatbed, drop-trailer programs, warehousing, and more. Our diverse service capabilities allow us to support shippers across industries with flexible, reliable, and scalable logistics strategies.

We partner with skilled global talent to support our continued growth and operational excellence, ensuring our customers receive efficient, high-quality service at every step of the supply chain.



ROLE SUMMARY:

The Junior Spot Market Pricing & Bidding Analyst supports real-time spot market bidding and freight quoting across load boards, applying established pricing experience to execute competitive, market-informed bids. This role is designed for an experienced pricing professional who is still developing deeper lane ownership and independent bid strategy in a fast-paced spot market environment.



Regular Weekly Schedule (40 hours): Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time with 1-hour unpaid lunch break from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Eastern. Overtime (40+ hours) requires manager approval.



JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: 

-Execute spot freight quoting and bidding across load boards using approved pricing strategies

-Monitor live market conditions, capacity trends, and carrier bid activity to adjust pricing in real time

-Analyze historical lane data and recent spot performance to inform pricing decisions

-Track bid outcomes, win/loss ratios, and pricing effectiveness by lane or customer

-Partner with operations and account teams to align pricing with execution realities

-Maintain pricing accuracy, responsiveness, and consistency in high-volume spot environments



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)

-Win Rate

--% of spot bids won

--Shows if pricing is competitive



-Speed to Quote

--Time to submit a spot quote

--Speed matters most in spot bidding



-Margin

--Margin achieved vs target or market

--Confirms we’re not over- or under-pricing



-Re-Pricing Rate

--% of loads that need price changes after award

--Measures pricing accuracy



COMPENSATION:

Compensation will be determined based on experience. All payments are issued in USD via Wise.



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

-4+ years of experience pricing and quoting freight, with a strong focus on spot market execution

-Hands-on experience bidding freight on load boards.

-Solid understanding of U.S. spot market dynamics, lane volatility, and capacity cycles

-Proven ability to quote freight quickly while balancing competitiveness and margin

-Strong working knowledge of Excel, pricing tools, or TMS platforms

-Preferred qualification: Experience supporting high-volume or time-sensitive spot freight

-Preferred qualification: Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Business, or a related field

-Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

-High attention to detail and accuracy

-Exceptional organizational and time management skills 



Access to:

-A reliable computer with  high-speed internet

--Backup internet source (mobile hotspot or secondary line preferred)

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

-Headset

-Professional remote workspace

-Ability to work U.S. business hours (EST)



Experience with:

-Outlook

-Zoom phone

-Slack

-Basic CRM or logistics platform



Additional Requirements



1. Technology & Equipment Requirements

-Reliable high-speed internet and computer

2. Availability Requirements

-Ability to work U.S. Eastern Time

title: Outbound Cold Caller — Boutique M&A Advisory Firm
description:
About the Role

Windsor Drake is a boutique investment banking advisory firm advising founders on the sale of companies valued between $3M and $50M. We work with private equity firms, strategic acquirers, and family offices across North America.

We are hiring an Outbound Cold Caller to support our deal origination and buyer outreach efforts. You will be calling business owners, CEOs, private equity professionals, and corporate development executives on behalf of senior bankers.

This role requires flawless American English with absolutely no detectable accent. You will be speaking with highly sophisticated business professionals who will immediately disengage if anything sounds off. This is non-negotiable — do not apply unless you are genuinely confident you sound American on the phone.



Responsibilities



Make 80-120+ outbound calls per day to targeted prospects from prepared lists

Deliver scripted and semi-scripted openers, then navigate live conversations naturally

Book qualified meetings and discovery calls for senior tea
mbers

Log all call activity, outcomes, and notes in HubSpot CRM

Follow up with prospects who requested callbacks or expressed interest

Handle objections professionally and know when to push and when to move on

Collaborate with the outreach team to refine scripts and improve conversion rates

Maintain a professional, authoritative tone on every call — you represent an investment bank, not a call center





Requirements



Native-level American English with zero accent — voice sample required with application

1+ year experience in outbound cold calling, SDR/BDR, or telemarketing serving US/Canadian markets

Comfortable making high-volume calls and handling rejection daily

Strong ability to think on your feet — real conversations, not robotic script reading

Professional and confident phone presence — calm, authoritative, peer-to-peer tone

Experience with CRM tools (HubSpot preferred)

Reliable internet, quality headset, and a completely quiet workspace

Available to work US Eastern hours consistently





Preferred but Not Required



Experience calling into financial services, private equity, or C-suite executives

Familiarity with M&A, business brokerage, or B2B professional services

Experience with Apollo, Instantly, or similar outreach tools





What Success Looks Like



Consistently booking 8-15+ qualified meetings per week

Prospects assume you are calling from a New York or Toronto office

Clean CRM hygiene with detailed call notes

Steady improvement in conversion rates over time





How to Apply

Submit the following:



Your resume

A 60-second voice recording of yourself reading the script below — one take, quiet room, no coaching:



"Hi, this is [Your Name] calling from Windsor Drake. We're a mergers and acquisitions advisory firm, and I'm reaching out because we're currently working with a company in your space that may be a strong strategic fit. I know I'm catching you out of the blue — do you have about two minutes, or should I send over a brief summary by
?"



A second 30-second recording of you answering this question off the cuff — no script, just talk naturally:



"Tell me about the last cold calling role you had. What were you selling, and what was your daily volume?"



A short note on why you are a strong fit for this role



Applications missing either voice recording will not be reviewed.

title: Amazon Online Arbitrage Sourcing VA (Growth-Focused, Long-Term Role)
description:
We are hiring a Growth-Focused Amazon Online Arbitrage Sourcing VA for a long-term opportunity. 



This role is ideal for someone with 6–18 months of Amazon Online Arbitrage experience who wants to grow within a clear, process-driven framework built on data and consistency.



This is NOT an agency-style role. We follow a specific sourcing system and are looking for someone coachable, detail-oriented, and motivated to grow within our business long-term.



What You’ll Be Doing:

-Sourcing profitable online arbitrage leads through storefront stalking, Keepa Product Finder, reverse sourcing, and manual sourcing

- Using SellerAmp to analyze ROI, profit, fees, and competition

- Reading and interpreting Keepa charts (price history, sales rank drops, Buy Box trend

- Submitting leads inside our tracking system

- Improving based on structured feedback



Required Experience:

- 6–18 months of Amazon Online Arbitrage experience

- Working knowledge of SellerAmp

- Ability to confidently read and interpret Keepa charts

- Basic understanding of sales rank, ROI, and profit calculations



Who This Role Is Perfect For:

- You have some Amazon OA experience but still want to grow

- You take feedback seriously and apply it immediately

- You are detail-oriented and organized

- You want a stable, long-term role (not freelance hopping)

- You are ambitious and open to increasing responsibility over time



Growth Opportunity:

- This is a long-term position with performance-based increases and potential leadership opportunities for the right candidate.



To Apply, Answer the Following:

- How many months of Amazon Online Arbitrage experience do you have?

- Describe your experience using SellerAmp and reading Keepa charts.

- Give an example of a good lead and explain why it is a good lead.

- Give an example of a bad lead and explain why it is a bad lead.

- Why does this role interest you long-term?



To confirm you read everything, start your application with the word “Growth.”



We are looking to hire soon and will begin with a short paid trial.

title: Remote Sales Rep
description:
About Cynergists: We provide advanced AI Agents designed to empower businesses to automate workflows, maximize productivity, and unlock limitless growth. We don't just fill seats; we deploy operations. Cynergists is moving beyond traditional staffing to define the future of intelligent automation. 

The Role: We are looking for a hungry, tech-curious individual to join our team. You do not need years of tech sales experience to apply. If you are coachable and ready to learn, our proprietary AI Sales Trainer will get you up to speed quickly.

Your primary goal is simple: Talk to business owners, identify their operational "bottlenecks," and match them with the perfect AI Agent from our catalog. If we don't have an agent ready, you will help scope a Custom AI Build to solve their unique problem.

Key Responsibilities:

Diagnostic Selling: Engage with leads to understand their current workflows and pain points. You aren’t just selling; you are diagnosing inefficiencies.

The "Matchmaker" Process:

Assess the client’s needs.

Direct them to the specific AI Agent on our website that solves that problem.

If a pre-made Agent doesn't exist, coordinate with our tech team to propose a Custom AI Agent Build.

Rapid Skill Development: Work daily with Briggs, our AI Sales Trainer, to refine your pitch, learn objection handling, and master the art of AI consulting.

Pipeline Management: Utilize Go High Level (GHL) to track leads, schedule follow-ups, and manage your deals from initial conversation to close.

Market Feedback: Listen to what business owners are asking for and relay that back to the development team to help us build the next generation of AI Agents.

What We Are Looking For:

Coachability is King: We value the ability to learn over a 10-page resume. You must be willing to train with Briggs and adapt your approach.

Tech-Savvy Mindset: You don't need to be a coder, but you must be excited about AI and comfortable navigating software.

Problem-Solving Skills: You need to be able to listen to a business owner complain about a task and immediately think, "I have an Agent for that."

Communication: Clear, confident verbal and written communication skills are non-negotiable.

GHL Experience: Proficiency in Go High Level is a plus, but not required if you are a fast learner.

Why Join Cynergists?

Cutting-Edge Training: Access to Briggs, our AI Sales Trainer, providing you with real-time feedback and development.

Sell the Future: You aren't selling outdated services; you are selling the most in-demand technology in the world.

Competitive Commission: Uncapped earning potential based on performance.

Remote Freedom: Work from anywhere with a supportive, innovative team.

To Apply: If you are ready to pivot your career into the world of Artificial Intelligence, submit your resume to 
 us why you think AI is the future of business in your cover letter.

title: Plumbing Estimator / Takeoff Specialist
description:
Job Overview



We are looking for a skilled and detail-oriented Plumbing Estimator / Takeoff Specialist to join our team full-time. This role is responsible for performing accurate plumbing takeoffs from hydraulic and ground plan drawings to support project estimating and tender submissions.



This is a long-term remote position with consistent work, ideal for candidates with experience in plumbing, construction estimating, or quantity takeoffs.



Key Responsibilities



• Review architectural, hydraulic, and plumbing drawings

• Perform accurate plumbing quantity takeoffs

• Measure pipe runs, fittings, fixtures, and related components

• Prepare takeoff summaries and reports in Excel

• Mark up drawings using Bluebeam Revu and/or Groundplan

• Assist with estimate preparation when required

• Identify missing or unclear information in drawings

• Maintain organized takeoff and estimate records

• Communicate clearly with the estimating team



Required Skills and Experience



• Proven experience with plumbing takeoffs or construction estimating

• Ability to read and interpret hydraulic and ground plan drawings

• Experience using Bluebeam Revu and/or Groundplan

• Strong attention to detail and accuracy

• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel

• Good written and verbal English communication skills

• Reliable internet connection and stable work environment



Preferred Qualifications (Advantageous but Not Required)



• Experience with SimPRO or similar estimating software

• Experience with Australian, US, or international construction projects

• Background in plumbing, construction, or engineering

• Experience working remotely with international teams



Why Join Us



• Long-term full-time role with consistent workload

• Work remotely from home

• Supportive and professional team environment

• Opportunity for growth into senior estimating roles



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:

Updated resume

Description of your plumbing takeoff experience

List of software you have used (Bluebeam, Groundplan, PlanSwift, etc.)

Sample takeoff work (if available)

Your availability and internet speed

Shortlisted candidates may be required to complete a short takeoff test.



IMPORTANT: Include the word BLUEBEAM in your application subject line to confirm you have read the job description.

title: Project Manager
description:
The Project Manager oversees the full lifecycle of multiple high-impact projects, ensuring seamless coordination between leadership, clients, and production teams. As the main point of contact across these groups, you ensure clarity of expectations, alignment of goals, and smooth execution from initiation to delivery. You are responsible for strategic planning, problem-solving, critical thinking, risk mitigation, progress reporting, and maintaining project quality and timelines. Additionally, aside from handling your own projects, you will train, mentor, coach, develop, and supervise junior project managers, ensuring consistency and excellence across all project operations.



Key Responsibilities

1. Project Planning & Execution

Create, manage, and optimize detailed project plans and schedules.





Define project scope, objectives, deliverables, and success metrics

Allocate resources effectively and monitor workload distribution.

Lead project implementation in collaboration with Team Leaders.

Apply critical thinking to anticipate challenges and devise proactive solutions.

Ensure projects remain aligned with company goals and client requirements.

2. Coordination & Communication

Serve as the main point of contact between leadership, clients, and production teams.

Ensure all stakeholders are aligned on progress, expectations, changes, and risks.

Present comprehensive updates, reports, and recommended solutions to leadership and clients.

Lead internal and external meetings, setting clear expectations for project teams.

3. Monitoring, Reporting & Risk Management

Track and evaluate project progress against timelines and milestones.

Identify, assess, and resolve project issues and risks proactively.

Implement process adjustments and change management when needed.

Apply problem-solving skills to remove bottlenecks or obstacles affecting project goals.

Prepare and deliver regular status reports, escalation updates, and performance summaries.

4. Team Leadership & Development

Guide and support the project team to maintain productivity and quality.

Provide direction to team members alongside Team Leaders.

Train, mentor, coach, develop, and supervise junior project managers.

Oversee projects handled by junior project managers to ensure quality, consistency, and timely delivery.

Encourage critical thinking and proactive problem-solving within the team.

5. Documentation & Deliverables Management

Oversee complete project documentation, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.

Upload deliverables to cloud-based platforms for backup and tracking.

Maintain organized records of milestones, reports, approvals, and revisions.

Conduct post-project evaluations to assess performance, identify improvement areas, and implement lessons learned.





Competencies

Critical thinking and structured problem-solving.

Strong decision-making, leadership, and delegation skills.

Skilled in contract negotiation and stakeholder management.

Conflict resolution experience with calm and professional approach.

High adaptability to shifting priorities and tight deadlines.

Ability to remain effective in high-pressure environments.

Analytical mindset to identify risks, challenges, and innovative solutions.



Send your application here:

title: Mental Health Credentialing
description:
Mental Health Administration with Focus on Credentialing and Insurance 







Job Overview:



This position is for a medium-sized private practice located in Rhode Island and services clients in mutiple other states. Help is needed to negotiate with insurance companies, Medicaid, and Medicare. Some understanding of mental health licensing is required.   You will be part of a small, established Filipino VA team and will be required to attend 1 staff meeting per week.

The ideal candidate will have knowledge of credentialing therapists with insurance panels and an understanding of claims and billing processes. This role will provide essential administrative support to our team and ensure the smooth operation of credentialing, billing, and general office tasks.



Responsibilities:

 • Submit and track applications, following up as needed to ensure timely approvals.

Billing & Claims Management:

 • Assist with verifying client insurance eligibility and benefits.

 • Support the submission, tracking, and reconciliation of insurance claims.

 • Address and resolve claim denials and discrepancies with insurance providers.

 • Assist with invoicing and follow-ups on outstanding balances.





Qualifications:

 • Experience in mental health administration or a similar field.

 • Knowledge of insurance credentialing and billing procedures.

 • Familiarity with EHR systems (e.g., SimplePractice, TherapyNotes, or similar).

 • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks.

 • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

How to Apply:



Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your experience in mental health administration, credentialing, and billing, and a short video stating why you would be a good fit for this specific job.

title: Freelance News Writer – International Whisky Website
description:
Hey!

We are looking for a dedicated freelance news writer for an international whisky website who can produce daily whisky-related news articles.



We are seeking someone who can deliver 3 news articles per day from Monday through Friday. The focus is on current, relevant, and factually accurate news within the whisky industry.

Each news article should take no longer than 30 minutes to write. We also expect you to upload the finished articles neatly and independently to our admin system.



Compensation

3 dollars per article

This equals approximately 180 dollars per month

This is a starting salary. With strong performance, platform growth, and a long-term collaboration, compensation can increase over time.



What We Are Looking For

We are looking for someone who:

• Has a strong affinity with whisky and understands the industry

• Can write 3 news articles per day from Monday to Friday

• Can complete each article within approximately 30 minutes

• Has a distinctive and engaging writing style

• Produces factually accurate articles and conducts proper research

• Does not rely solely on ChatGPT or other AI tools to generate content

• Is fluent in English

• Has basic knowledge of SEO, including headings, keywords, and readability

• Can upload articles independently and correctly into our admin system

• Meets deadlines consistently

The articles must be suitable for an international audience and ready for professional publication on a news platform.





Important

We are not looking for copy-paste work or fully AI-generated content. AI tools may be used for support in research or structuring, but the articles must clearly reflect a human writing style and be factually correct.



What You Can Expect

• A consistent monthly collaboration

• Growth opportunities based on performance

• The chance to grow with an international whisky platform

• Potential expansion into interviews, feature articles, or special reports





Application

Interested?

Please send:

• 2 to 3 examples of previously written articles, preferably in English

• A short explanation of your experience with whisky

• Any SEO experience you may have

• Your availability

• Your connection to or history with whisky



If you have read this entire job description, tell us what your first glass of whisky was and which brand it was.

We look forward to building a long-term collaboration with someone who truly has a passion for whisky and values quality

title: Creative Director/Youtube Strategist/Youtube Producer
description:
Who We Are & Why This Role Matters

Hey there! We’re looking for a YouTube Creative Director who can work closely with established business owners, YouTube entrepreneurs, business coaches, and content creators to create killer content that drives engagement and business growth.



You’ll be part of the core team and you’ll be an active collaborator in content ideation, planning, and execution, ensuring every piece aligns with the business owner's brand and business goals.



What You’ll Be Doing

Work directly with the CEO and team to shape the video content roadmap

Develop and refine content ideas that align with business owner’s brand and business goals; Work directly with the CEO and team to shape the video content roadmap

Help with content creation, from ideation to execution, ensuring high-quality output [Help write scripts, edit videos, create social media posts, and long-form content while maintaining the client’s voice]

Research and integrate YouTube growth strategies into content planning

Collaborate with the production team to optimize content for YouTube algorithms; Analyze content performance and adjust strategies to maximize engagement and conversions

Develop video concepts from initial brainstorming through scriptwriting and production planning.

Assist on ad hoc tasks including but not limited to: Creating presentations using Miro, Google Slides, or similar tools that translate client’s ideas into visually engaging narratives.

What We’re Looking For

Non-Negotiables

Proven experience leading YouTube creative strategy or managing a high-growth channel

Deep understanding of YouTube culture, algorithm, and audience psychology

Excellent communication and leadership skills

Ability to visualize and execute engaging presentations

Data-driven and analytical, but also intuitive and trend-aware

Comfort with fluid schedules and occasional urgent requests



Bonus Points If You Have:

Background in marketing, branding, or viral content creation

You're organized enough to manage multiple projects but flexible enough to pivot when inspiration (or urgent client needs) strikes.

Knowledge of YouTube marketing, SEO, and monetization strategies

Experience managing and growing YouTube accounts



We value diverse perspectives and experiences. 



If you connect with this role but don't check every box, we still encourage you to apply. Sometimes the perfect voice for our clients comes from unexpected places.



Why Join Us?

Be part of a high-growth team: We’re scaling fast, and you’ll play a key role in making it happen.

Creative freedom and input on strategy and execution

Grow your career & skills: Gain hands-on experience in YouTube marketing, content strategy, and digital business growth.

Competitive pay & growth opportunities: We recognize and reward great work.

Supportive remote-first culture with tea
mbers across the Philippines and beyond

Make a real impact – The content you create will inspire, educate, and change lives for people looking to build online businesses and careers.

title: Executive Assistant / Outreach Specialist
description:
Blakely Brown is seeking a dedicated and professional individual to join our team as an Executive Assistant/Outreach Specialist. This role is pivotal in ensuring smooth and efficient communication with our clients from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM EST and managing complex scheduling requirements and other admin tasks.



If you're are passionate about data and EXCITED TO BRING ENERGY to work every day, then you're perfect for the team! We're looking for someone who's HARDWORKING with A GREAT PERSONALITY to join our team! If you have excellent communication skills and a genuine enthusiasm as a Virtual Assistant, this is the opportunity for you. Impress the owners with your passion, and wow us during the interview!



Position: Executive Assistant/Outreach Specialist

Location: Remote (Must be available during Eastern Standard Time - EST)

Type: Full-Time



Key Responsibilities:



- Outreach Campaigns: Coordinating with the team to successfully launch outreach campaigns and handling responses.

- Calendar Management: Efficiently manage and organize the executive's calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.

- Client Communication: Serve as the first point of contact for clients, handling correspondence and communications with professionalism and discretion.

- Administrative Support: Provide comprehensive administrative support to the executive team, including document preparation, managing
s, and coordinating events.

- Project Coordination: Assist with project management tasks, ensuring deadlines are met and stakeholders are informed of progress.

- Confidentiality: Maintain the highest level of confidentiality and discretion with sensitive company and client information.



Requirements:



- Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar administrative support role.

- Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate directly with clients and tea
mbers.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and virtual meeting platforms (Zoom, Google Meet).

- Ability to work independently and in a remote setting, available during Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours.

- A proactive approach to problem-solving and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.



Benefits:



- Competitive salary with 13th Month Pay (500 GBP starting rate)

- 12 paid vacation leave per year and some public holidays in the Philippines are observed

- Opportunities for professional growth and development.

- Supportive and collaborative work environment.





How to Apply:



Please send your resume (PDF format: CV_Full Name) to 
 (remove the spaces between before and after 
 with the subject line: Executive Assistant - followed by an adjective that describes you.



KEEP IN MIND... "Following instructions is the most basic, yet essential, step toward achieving success." :-)



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Dispute Manager (E-commerce / Dropshipping Expert)
description:
Hiring: Dispute Manager (E-commerce / Dropshipping)



We are a fast-scaling international e-commerce company operating multiple dropshipping brands.



We are looking for an experienced Dispute Manager to take full ownership of chargebacks and payment disputes.



This is a performance-driven role. We need someone who understands payment processors and knows how to win cases consistently.



Main Responsibilities



Handle all incoming disputes daily (PayPal, Stripe, Shopify Payments)



Submit strong evidence packages before deadlines



Monitor dispute ratios and win rates



Identify fraud patterns (INR, SNAD, Unauthorized)



Work closely with Customer Support and Fulfillment



Track delivery confirmations and proof of delivery



Maintain organized dispute dashboard (Google Sheets / Notion)



Required Experience



Proven experience with dropshipping stores



Experience handling PayPal & Stripe disputes



Understanding of dispute types:



Item Not Received (INR)



Significantly Not As Described (SNAD)



Fraud / Unauthorized



Strong evidence submission skills



Experience using tracking platforms (17Track, 4PX, YunExpress, etc.)



Experience reducing dispute ratio below 0.9%



KPIs



Win rate %



Monthly dispute ratio



Financial loss reduction



Response time



Ideal Candidate



Detail-oriented



Data-driven



Structured



Calm under pressure



Proactive and responsible



To apply, send:



Your previous dispute management experience



Average win rate



Payment processors handled



Why you are a strong fit



Applications without real experience will not be considered.

title: UK Quantity Surveyor
description:
Are you an Architect or Civil Engineer with experience in pricing UK Residential Construction Projects?



If your answer is a resounding "YES" then this opportunity is for you!



Position: Quantity Surveyor

Salary: Negotiable

Job Type: Part-time (20 hours per week)



Your main responsibilities will be to:

- Price UK residential construction projects, including extensions and refurbishments

- Read and interpret residential construction drawings confidently

- Print drawings to A3 where required

- Measure works using: Scaled drawings, Given dimensions, Scaling from drawings where dimensions are missing

- Use appropriate measurement tools, including: Physical scale rulers, Digital take-off software

- Produce detailed cost breakdowns for each project

- Prepare comprehensive client-ready proposals using the company’s provided format

- Follow internal pricing processes and tools

- Document pricing templates for future reference

- Work in a highly organised and methodical manner

- Follow established SOPs, structured workflows, and version control practices

- Learn new systems as required

- Be proactive in day-to-day work by: Flagging issues or inconsistencies, Asking clear, intelligent questions, Making practical suggestions for improvement

- Use the company’s proprietary pricing software for live pricing work

- Provide structured feedback on the pricing software

- Identify gaps, bugs, or improvement opportunities

- Develop into a confident power user of the pricing system over time



You MUST:

- Be highly organised and methodical

- Be confident using software and learning new systems

- Be proactive



Must-have qualifications:

- Degree in Civil Engineering or any construction-related courses

- Experience in pricing UK residential construction projects

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

- Skilled in using estimating and pricing platforms

- Skilled in creating comprehensive, client-ready proposals

- Background in Quantity Surveying, Estimating, Construction Management, Engineering, or a similar technical construction discipline

- Strong understanding of residential construction methods, sequencing of works, labour vs. materials, and trade packages

- Able to interpret architectural drawings, structural drawings, and specification notes



Additional, nice-to-have qualifications:

- Experience with UK building regulations and standards

- Familiarity with software tools such as Buildertrend, CostX, or similar estimating platforms

- Experience creating templates for repeatable pricing workflows



To apply:

Please include the link to your Resume in your application.

title: Sales Representative – International Whisky Website
description:
Are you proactive, commercially minded, and confident in reaching out to companies? Do you have an interest in whisky, premium brands, or online media? Then this opportunity might be a great fit for you.

For our international whisky website, we are looking for a Sales Representative who will approach brands and secure branded content collaborations.



About the Role

We offer companies visibility through branded content on our website. This can include:

• Articles about a specific whisky glass

• In-depth features about a whisky brand

• Background stories about the company behind a whisky brand

• Content focused on new releases or special bottlings

Your responsibility is purely sales.

You will contact potential partners, introduce our platform, and explore collaboration opportunities.



Important:

You are not responsible for writing content, managing campaigns, or publishing articles. Once a deal is closed, our team takes over the full execution process.



Working Structure

We ask you to work 1 hour per day, from Monday to Friday.

• Hourly payment: 3 dollar per hour

s to potential clients

• The
 template is largely prepared for you

• If you send more
s and generate successful deals, you can earn additional bonuses

This structure provides stable base income while offering strong upside through performance-based rewards.



What We Provide

• A professional media kit

• A company
 address

 template

We encourage initiative, but you will never be left without support.

• Someone comfortable with outreach and sales

• Professional communication skills in English

• Reliable and consistent

• Proactive and results-driven

• Interest in whisky, premium brands, or online media is a plus



Why This Is a Good Opportunity

title: Senior Travel API Developer Needed – Build High-Performance Hotel Aggregation & Booking Platform (OTA Level)
description:
Project Overview



We are 
, an established travel company operating for over 10 years. We are building our own high-performance hotel booking platform to search multiple hotel suppliers simultaneously and book at the cheapest available rate.



This is a serious OTA-level system similar to 
, Agoda, or Expedia (scaled appropriately).



We are NOT looking for generic web developers. Only apply if you have direct experience integrating hotel supplier APIs and building booking engines.



?



Core Objectives



Build a fast, scalable hotel aggregation and booking platform that can:



• Search hotels across multiple suppliers simultaneously

• Display unified hotel listings (no duplicates)

• Show cheapest supplier automatically

• Complete bookings via supplier APIs

• Store booking data and confirmations

• Handle cancellations and refunds

• Operate as merchant-of-record (we charge the customer directly)



?



Supplier integrations required



Phase 1 (mandatory):



• RateHawk API integration

• Hotelbeds API integration



Phase 2 (after Phase 1 complete):



• Agoda API integration

• WebBeds API integration



You must have prior experience integrating at least one of these suppliers or similar hotel XML / REST APIs.



?



System requirements



Backend:



• Node.js or Python (required)

• PostgreSQL database

• Redis caching layer (required for fast search performance)

• ElasticSearch or similar search index

• Proper hotel mapping system to unify supplier listings



Frontend:



• React or Next.js

• Fast hotel search results page

• Hotel details page

• Booking checkout flow

• Customer dashboard for viewing bookings



Infrastructure:



• AWS, Google Cloud, or similar cloud hosting

• Scalable architecture

• Secure payment integration (Stripe or similar)



?



Critical performance requirements



Search speed target:



• Under 2 seconds response time



System must:



• Prevent duplicate hotel listings

• Handle supplier API failures gracefully

• Automatically select cheapest supplier

• Be stable and production-ready



?



Required experience (MANDATORY)



Only apply if you have experience with at least one of the following:



• Hotelbeds API

• Agoda API

• WebBeds API

• RateHawk API

• Expedia API

• OTA booking engine development



You must provide:



• Examples of travel booking engines you built

• Your role in those projects

• Tech stack used

• Screenshots or live links



Applications without travel API experience will be rejected.



?



Project scope and timeline



Phase 1 target timeline:



6–10 weeks



Long-term development opportunity available after initial build.



?



Budget



Fixed price preferred.



Budget range: $8000 AUD depending on experience and proven track record.



?



Important



This is a serious project. We are looking for experienced travel technology developers only.



We prioritize quality, stability, and long-term scalability over lowest cost.

title: AI Engineer (Agentic Automation & Code-Driven AI Workflows)
description:
About the Role:

We’re looking for an AI Engineer who can design, build, and deliver scalable AI-driven automation solutions using modern AI coding agents and CLI tools. You’ll work closely with engineering teams to transform manual workflows into autonomous, intelligent systems and integrate advanced large language model (LLM) tools into everyday developer productivity and automation pipelines.



Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and deploy AI-powered automation workflows that reduce manual effort and improve operational efficiency.



Build and maintain agentic automation systems using AI coding agents and CLI tools such as Claude Code, OpenAI Codex CLI, and Google Gemini-CLI.



Integrate LLMs and AI tools into product and infrastructure workflows via CLI, SDKs, or API interfaces.



Create reusable agent workflows, scripts, and tooling that can execute autonomously with minimal human intervention.



Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define automation use cases, gather requirements, and deliver solutions.



Develop prompt engineering strategies and templates optimized for agentic task execution.



Implement robust logging, error handling, and observability for automated systems.



Continuously evaluate and recommend new agent tools and capabilities to improve automation outcomes.



Qualifications Required:

1–2 years of professional experience working with AI/ML or AI-driven development tools.



Hands-on experience using agentic automation frameworks, CLI AI coding tools (e.g., Claude Code, Codex CLI, Gemini CLI), or similar tools.



Proficiency with at least one scripting or programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar).



Strong understanding of agentic workflows, automated pipelines, and basic DevOps practices.



Experience with prompt engineering for LLMs and integrating LLM-based solutions into automation systems.



Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.





Preferred:

Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure) and deployment practices.



Knowledge of software engineering best practices (version control, testing, CI/CD).

title: Recruiting & Onboarding Assistant (Support to Recruiting Manager)
description:
TimeProof Required | GoHighLevel + ATS | Weekly Check-Ins | Process + Documentation



We’re a U.S.-based commercial services company building a structured internal hiring operation. We’re hiring a Recruiting & Onboarding Assistant to support our Recruiting Manager by keeping recruiting workflows, candidate communication, onboarding steps, and documentation organized and on track.



This role is execution-focused, process-driven, and requires strong follow-through.





Core Responsibilities



1) Recruiting Support

 • Post and maintain job ads across platforms

 • Source applicants through job boards and social channels

 • Review resumes and complete initial screening steps

 • Schedule interviews and maintain clear candidate notes

 • Manage candidate follow-ups (SMS/email/calls) inside GoHighLevel

 • Keep candidates moving through the pipeline with accurate statuses



2) Onboarding Support

 • Coordinate onboarding steps from start to finish

 • Send required forms/links and confirm completion

 • Communicate expectations and next steps clearly

 • Track onboarding/training progress in GHL/ATS

 • Confirm readiness before candidates are activated/scheduled



3) Compliance & Documentation

 • Collect and organize: W-9/W-4, IDs, licenses, certifications, required forms

 • Store files correctly and keep records complete

 • Maintain clean tags, tasks, notes, and checklists



4) Client & Candidate Communication (Phone Required)

 • Document outcomes and next steps inside the system



5) Process Support (SOPs + Checklists)

 • Maintain and update SOPs/checklists for recruiting and onboarding

 • Help improve workflows by documenting what works and what doesn’t

 • Create templates for repeatable steps (messages, checklists, follow-up sequences)



6) Systems Coordination

 • Keep pipelines, tasks, and follow-ups current in GoHighLevel

 • Provide weekly updates and status reporting to the Recruiting Manager

 • Ensure nothing is missed or left incomplete





Required Experience



You must already have experience with:

 • GoHighLevel (GHL) (pipelines, tags, tasks, notes, forms, workflows)

 • An ATS or recruiting CRM (Zoho Recruit, CEIPAL, Bullhorn, Tracker, JobAdder, etc.)

Non-Negotiables

 • Strong organization and follow-through

 • Clear spoken + written English

 • Comfortable with phone communication

 • Able to follow a defined process and maintain clean records

 • Reliable, responsive, and consistent during EST work blocks

 • TimeProof tracking required





Schedule + Tracking

 • Full-time: 40 hrs/week

 • Weekly meeting + quick check-ins as needed

 • TimeProof required (screenshots + activity logs)



?



To Apply (All 3 Required)

 1. Video Introduction (2–4 minutes): recruiting background, onboarding experience, client/candidate calling, GHL + ATS experience, and an example of a checklist/SOP you’ve supported

 2. Resume

 3. Systems List (tools used)

title: $1,200/month to manage $50K+ in ad spend across 12 countries — with a clear path to Head of Growth
description:
We're a fast-scaling e-commerce brand in the pet niche, operating across 12+ European markets. Our business runs on two models: 70% COD (Cash on Delivery) and 30% dropshipping. We manage multiple products, multiple funnels, and multiple countries — all at once.

We're currently in aggressive expansion mode with a 3-year objective of $100M/year in revenue. We need ONE strategic Media Buyer to join the core team and grow with us long-term. 

This is NOT a "check ROAS and increase budgets" role since it's easily automated with AI. We need someone who thinks like a entrepreneur and have a strong overall comprehensive of the e-commerce business. 



To apply: 



???? WHAT YOU'LL DO



Launch, monitor, and optimize Meta ad campaigns across 12+ European markets for multiple products

Make kill / scale / reborn decisions based on ROAS, spend data, CPM context, and your own judgment

Manage budgets across COD and dropshipping models — each has different KPIs and constraints

Produce daily performance reports with clear hypotheses explaining WHY results look the way they do

Check stock levels before scaling any COD market — in COD, you maximize ROI on inventory, not just ROI on spend

Identify patterns across markets and flag issues beyond ads: broken pages, bad translations, weak offers, stock shortages

Understand the full funnel: offers, advertorials, landing pages, product pages, checkout flows

Optimize spend allocation — push budget where the returns are highest, cut fast where they're not



???? WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Must-Have:



1-2+ years of hands-on Meta Ads media buying experience (agency or in-house e-commerce)

Experience with COD and/or dropshipping models

Strong analytical thinking — you look at a dashboard and tell a story, not just read numbers

Comfortable managing campaigns across multiple countries simultaneously

Proactive communicator — you flag issues, propose solutions, and share insights daily without being asked

Fluent English (written reports and async communication)

Available 6 days/week, including Sundays (Monday off)



Nice-to-Have:



Experience in the pet niche or health/wellness e-commerce

Familiarity with European COD markets (Southern & Eastern Europe)

Knowledge of Shopify, funnel building, or CRO

Understanding of creative strategy and ad angle testing



???? WHAT WE OFFER



$800 - $1,200/month based on experience and proven results

Full-time remote position — we value results, not hours clocked

Direct path to Head of Growth as the company scales toward $100M/year

Real impact — you directly influence strategy, revenue, and company direction

Long-term commitment — we're building a core team for the next 5-10 years, not hiring for a project

Work on a fast-growing brand with real products, real customers, and real scale across 12+ countries



???? THIS ROLE IS NOT FOR YOU IF...



You only know how to toggle budgets up and down based on ROAS

You can't explain WHY a campaign is performing the way it is

You're not comfortable working across multiple markets with different dynamics

You treat media buying as a 9-to-5 task instead of a strategic function

You're looking for a short-term gig



???? HOW TO APPLY

The form includes real scenarios we face daily. It takes 20-30 minutes to complete properly. We read every single application — if you're the right fit, we'll reach out within 3 business days.

We don't hire for skills alone — we hire for thinking.

Important: If you've read this far, congratulations — you've passed the first test. To confirm you read this entire post, when asked for your age, enter "6". Applications without this will not be reviewed.



Fill out our application form here:

title: Executive Assistant to Managing Director — Boutique M&A Advisory Firm

 correspondence

Handle confidential information with absolute discretion

Native-level American English — spoken and written — with no detectable accent (voice sample required with application)

2+ years experience as a VA, EA, or in a client-facing phone role serving US-based clients

Professional, polished phone presence — you sound like you are sitting in a Manhattan office

How to Apply

Your resume

A 60-second voice recording of yourself reading the paragraph below — recorded in a quiet room, no script coaching, one take:

title: Graphic Designer/Video Editor

We turn cold traffic into buyers using data-driven creatives and structured media buying. Now we’re looking for a true A-player who can own both creative performance and media buying execution.

Media Buying

-  Monitor real ROAS (not just platfor
trics) and make decisions accordingly

You’ll be inside Ads Manager daily — but also thinking strategically about why ads win or lose.



What You Bring

- Strong understanding of direct-response marketing & buyer psychology

- Deep knowledge of Meta Ads structures, scaling strategies, and testing frameworks

- Analytical mindset — you think in numbers, patterns, and outcomes

- Experience in the Beauty & Health niche.

- Ownership, of your role in the business and expansion.

You understand that:

Creative drives performance

Structure protects profit

Data d
 everything

?? Working Hours (Very Important)

Apply now — let’s scale together ????

title: Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager
description:
About Us

We are a growing finance and accounting firm providing outsourced CFO, accounting, and financial management services to high-growth companies. Our clients operate across various industries, including technology, e-commerce, and professional services. We leverage modern financial tools like QuickBooks Online, Ramp, and Gusto to deliver efficient, scalable solutions.



Job Description

We are seeking a Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager to manage client financial operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, compliance, and strategic financial guidance. This role requires a strong accounting background, attention to detail, and experience with cloud-based accounting systems.



Key Responsibilities

Perform monthly account reconciliations and bookkeeping using QuickBooks Online.

Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports (Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Cash Flow).

Manage accounts payable (AP) and accounts receivable (AR), including invoicing, payment processing, and collections.

Oversee intercompany transactions and multi-entity accounting structures.

Handle payroll processing and tax filings through Gusto.

Support sales and use tax reporting, working with external service providers as needed.

Assist with corporate legal entity management, ensuring compliance with state and federal regulations.

Lead risk management efforts, including state and federal compliance and insurance tracking.

Oversee treasury management, optimizing cash flow and banking relationships.

Support tax strategy and reporting in collaboration with tax advisors.

Qualifications & Skills
