Experience using Ramp for expense management and Gusto for payroll processing.

Proficiency in GAAP accounting principles and multi-entity consolidations.

Strong understanding of accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll functions.

Knowledge of sales tax and corporate tax reporting processes.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication skills for interacting with clients and stakeholders.

Ability to work independently in a remote environment with strong time management skills.

Preferred Qualifications

CPA or CMA certification preferred but not required.

Experience working in a high-growth startup or tech company.

Background in e-commerce or SaaS accounting.

Exposure to financial modeling and forecasting.



What We Offer

Remote work flexibility with a supportive, collaborative team.

Opportunity for career growth in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Access to cutting-edge financial tools and automation to streamline workflows.

title: Remote B2B Business Development Representative
description:
We’re looking for a motivated and results-driven Business Development Representative to help grow our sales pipeline and expand our customer base. As a BDR, you’ll be on the front lines of our sales efforts, identifying potential clients, generating leads, and nurturing opportunities to connect them with our solutions.



Key Responsibilities:

1. Proactively research and identify potential customers in target markets.

2. Reach out to prospects via
s, LinkedIn, and other communication channels.

3. Qualify leads to assess fit and interest, ensuring alignment with our services.

4. Schedule meetings or product demos between qualified leads and Sales Development Representatives.

5. Maintain accurate records of lead interactions and update CRM systems accordingly.

6. Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to execute campaigns and optimize lead generation strategies.

7. Stay up-to-date on industry trends and our product/service offerings to effectively communicate value propositions.



Qualifications:

- Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

- 2 - 3 years of experience in sales, business development, or a similar role (entry-level candidates with strong communication skills and a hunger to learn are also encouraged to apply).

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport quickly.

- Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and eager to exceed targets.

- Proficiency in extracting data from LinkedIn Sales Navigator and other professional networks

- Must have a well-optimized LinkedIn account with atleast a minimum of 300 connections that can be used for prospecting

- Familiarity with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, PipeDrive) is a plus.

- Comfortable with cold outreach and prospecting.



Who we are:

Acadium started with the belief that anyone, anywhere, should be able to get the skills and experience they need to start their career without barriers like price, schedule, or location getting in their way. Acadium gives anyone the tools, support, and mentorship they need to launch their dream career. Acadium is the only platform that provides real work experience, accessible to everyone. Acadium began in 2017 with a team of 3 co-founders: Richard Shaw, Marco Tundo, and Moe Abbas. Since then, they’ve attracted more than 120,000 student members and over 50,000 businesses to connect through the apprenticeship marketplace. Our team is growing and looking for people who are motivated, intelligent, and committed to making education accessible to join our team.



What we value:

Integrity - Be trustworthy in your actions

Care - Treat your teammates and our community as you would want to be treated

Curiosity - Ask questions. Always state your assumptions

Tenacity - Persevere when times are tough

Discipline - Be consistent in your actions

Ambition - Aspire to become better every day

Service -Serve your community to the best of your abilities.



Interested applicants may send updated CVs and LinkedIn URLs to the contact person's
 address indicated below

 Subject: Business Development Representative

**Note: Only applicants who submit their resumes and LinkedIn links to 
 will be evaluated.

title: Accountant / CPA
description:
We operate a U.S.-based intermodal trucking company with both company drivers and owner-operators.



We are looking for an experienced virtual accountant to analyze revenue, costs, and true profit per load, so ownership can clearly understand which side of the business is more profitable.



???? This is NOT a full-time role

???? This is a weekly reporting position



What You’ll Be Responsible For

You will receive:



Company driver settlements



Owner-operator settlements



Agency / franchise settlements (US1)



Load-level revenue and expense data



Your responsibility is to categorize, calculate, and report profitability per load and per driver.



Scope of Work

1. Company Driver Loads (11 company trucks)

For each load, you will track:



Total load revenue



Fuel cost per load



Toll costs per load



Yard space cost (daily allocation)



Tolls per driver (daily allocation)



Any other direct operating costs



You will calculate:



Net profit per load



Net profit per driver



Total company-driver profitability (weekly)



2. Owner-Operator Loads

For each load, you will track:



Total load revenue



Amount paid to the owner-operator



Amount paid to the franchise/agency (US1)



Net amount retained by our company



You will calculate:



Profit per owner-operator load



Total owner-operator profitability (weekly)



3. Weekly Reports (Critical)

Data provided every Monday



Reports due every Wednesday



Reports must clearly show:



Company driver profit vs owner-operator profit



Profit per load



Profit per driver



Bottom-line comparison of both business models



Current Operation Size

41 drivers total



Mix of company drivers and owner-operators



U.S.-based freight operations



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

Accounting or CPA background (Philippines-based OK)



Experience with trucking / transportation / logistics accounting (preferred)



Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills



Comfortable with cost allocation and profitability analysis



Able to meet weekly deadlines without reminders



Strong written English



Work Schedule & Pay

Part-time / weekly work



Ongoing role



Pay based on experience (please include your expected rate)



To Apply (Important)

Please answer the following questions in your application:



Describe your accounting experience related to trucking, logistics, or cost-based businesses



Explain how you would calculate true profit per load



What accounting tools or software have you used?



Can you consistently meet a Monday–Wednesday weekly turnaround?

title: UGC Project Coordinator
description:
Hi there! Our advertising agency is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and communicative UGC Project Coordinator to join our performance marketing agency that specializes in paid social media advertising for e-commerce brands. 



As a UGC Project Coordinator, your mission is to ensure content projects stay on schedule, creators are well-briefed, and communication remains seamless from initial outreach to final asset delivery. 



[About You]

What you have:

Must-have: Exceptional written English with the ability to adapt tone (from professional to "influencer-friendly").

Must-have: Organization; Mastery of project management software and spreadsheets.

UGC Knowledge: A solid understanding of what makes a high-performing UGC video (hooks, transitions, organic feel).

Influencer and Affiliate Marketing Knowledge: Experience with casting creators and managing campaigns and assets

Problem Solving: Ability to handle "no-shows" or shipping delays with grace and quick pivots.

Experience: Previous experience in Influencer Marketing or Social Media Coordination is highly preferred.

Nice to have: Whitelisting and Meta Business Ad knowledge





[About The Role]

This is a full-time role with 37.5 hours per week available. Time will be tracked in our project management system, ClickUp, and wages will be paid out monthly.

Hours: 8 AM-4 PM EST. 



The successful candidate will be responsible for:



1. Creator Outreach & Onboarding

Identify and vet potential UGC creators based on brand aesthetics and target demographics.

Manage initial outreach campaigns via
, Instagram DM, or TikTok.

Onboard new creators by sending contracts, brand guidelines, and product shipping information.



2. Project Coordination

Maintain the Content Calendar to ensure all deadlines for filming and posting are met.

Track product shipments and verify that creators have received items before filming starts.

Ensure all creators follow the provided Creative Briefs (hooks, CTAs, lighting requirements).



3. Communication Management

Act as the main point of contact for all creator inquiries.

Send friendly reminders for upcoming deadlines or overdue content.

Provide constructive feedback from the internal team to creators for any necessary revisions.



4. Asset Management & Reporting

Collect raw and edited files, ensuring they are organized in Google Drive or Dropbox.

Update project management tools (ClickUP) in real-time.

Basic auditing of content to ensure it meets technical specs (ratio, resolution, no watermarks).



[How to Apply]

To apply, please send your resume and portfolio to 
 with the subject line “APPLICATION: "UGC Project Coordinator"



If shortlisted, we’ll follow up to schedule a video meeting.

title: STREETWEAR/GRAFFITI/TYPO/WHATEVER WE SAY ARTIST
description:
Senior Multi-Disciplinary Brand & Design Architect



Direct Engagement | High-Discretion Role | Sophisticated Global Brand Environment



Position Overview



We are seeking an exceptionally advanced, culturally fluent, and execution-driven Brand & Design Architect to work directly with us on the ongoing design, evolution, and protection of our brand ecosystem.



This is not a freelance marketplace role and not a single-style designer position. You will operate as a trusted, embedded creative partner, working closely with ownership and leadership across luxury, streetwear, heritage, consumer, digital, and physical brand environments.



This role requires mastery of multiple visual languages, strategic thinking, elite execution, and an uncompromising standard of professionalism, discretion, and reliability.



We determine whether or not your work is on par and could then be published.



?



Nature of Engagement

 • You will work directly with us, not through intermediaries

 • You must be able to align with our working hours, timelines, and pace

 • High availability, responsiveness, and follow-through are expected

 • This role involves access to confidential brand strategy, unreleased designs, and proprietary materials

 • Absolute discretion and confidentiality are mandatory



This position is designed for designers who understand trust, long-term alignment, and high-stakes creative environments.



?



Core Responsibilities

 1. Brand Architecture & Visual Governance

 • Design, evolve, and protect cohesive brand systems across all touchpoints

 • Maintain visual consistency while enabling controlled stylistic range

 • Translate strategic direction into precise, repeatable execution

 2. Multi-Style Design Mastery

 • Confidently design across:

 • Luxury and elevated minimalism

 • Streetwear and cultural counterpoints

 • Heritage and archival-inspired systems

 • Mass-culture consumer branding

 • Experimental and future-forward aesthetics

 • Every stylistic decision must be intentional, justified, and controlled

 3. Product, Apparel & Drop-Based Design

 • Design graphics, typography, layouts, and treatments for apparel and products

 • Support limited drops, campaigns, and long-term collections

 • Design with real-world production, materials, and scalability in mind

 4. Digital & Physical Brand Execution

 • Create assets for websites, apps, social, campaigns, and motion environments

 • Extend brand language into retail, pop-ups, packaging, signage, and physical spaces

 • Ensure digital and physical expressions feel unified and deliberate

 5. Cultural Intelligence & Strategic Relevance

 • Maintain deep awareness of global fashion, art, music, and urban culture

 • Apply trends selectively and strategically, never impulsively

 • Prioritize longevity, credibility, and brand equity over short-term hype

 6. Collaboration & Professional Discipline

 • Work closely with leadership, marketing, production, and strategy teams

 • Present work clearly, confidently, and with rationale

 • Iterate efficiently without sacrificing quality or intent



?



Required Qualifications

 • Proven experience designing across multiple brand tiers and aesthetics

 • Advanced proficiency in professional design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, etc.)

 • Strong command of typography, layout systems, color theory, and composition

 • Experience delivering both digital and physical outputs

 • Ability to operate independently with minimal oversight

 • Exceptional attention to detail and execution quality

 • Strong communication skills and professional maturity



?



Portfolio Submission Requirements (Mandatory)



Applicants must submit a serious, well-curated portfolio demonstrating:

 • Clear range and versatility across distinct visual styles

 • Strategic thinking, including context and reasoning behind decisions

 • End-to-end execution, from concept through final output

 • Clear indication of your role and ownership in each project



Applications without a strong portfolio will not be considered.



?



Services & Capabilities Expected



You may be required to deliver:

 • Brand identity systems and visual guidelines

 • Apparel and product design assets

 • Campaign and launch visuals

 • Web and app design components

 • Retail and environmental branding

 • Packaging and physical collateral

 • Ongoing creative direction and visual oversight



?



Confidentiality, IP & Professional Standards

 • You must be extremely discreet regarding all work, communications, and materials

 • No work produced for us may be shared, published, reused, or referenced without explicit written permission

 • NDA, IP ownership, and confidentiality agreements will be required prior to engagement

 • This role demands absolute trust, discretion, and professionalism



?



Ideal Candidate



You are disciplined, culturally fluent, and strategically minded.

You understand that great design is not decoration — it is control, intention, and execution.

You are comfortable operating at a high level, under confidentiality, with long-term brand responsibility.



Exact Art & Design Styles Required (Non-Exhaustive)



The designer must demonstrate working mastery of the following specific, recognized art and design styles, with the ability to apply them appropriately across apparel, branding, digital, and physical environments:

 • Swiss / International Typographic Style

Grid-based systems, asymmetric layouts, objective typography, precision hierarchy, and clarity-driven composition.

 • Bauhaus & Modernist Design

Functional minimalism, geometric forms, primary color logic, and design driven by purpose rather than decoration.

 • Postmodern & Deconstructivist Design

Intentional rule-breaking, layered systems, visual tension, expressive typography, and controlled chaos.

 • Brutalist Graphic Design

Raw layouts, stark typography, high contrast, utilitarian structures, and anti-polish aesthetics.

 • Editorial & High-Fashion Art Direction

Magazine-driven composition, art-directed photography, typographic narrative, and visual pacing.

 • Luxury Minimalism

Extreme restraint, typographic refinement, tonal palettes, spacing discipline, and material sensitivity.

 • Streetwear & Underground Graphics

Poster culture, DIY aesthetics, cultural symbolism, stencil logic, graffiti-adjacent systems, and raw graphic expression.

 • Heritage / Archival Revival

Vintage typography, historical print methods, retro layouts, brand archaeology, and legacy reinterpretation.

 • Pop Art & Commercial Iconography

Bold color, repetition, simplified forms, mass-culture visual language, and instant recognizability.

 • Psychedelic & Experimental Graphics

Distorted typography, optical play, organic forms, layered visuals, and sensory-driven composition.

 • Futurist / Neo-Futurist Design

Motion-forward thinking, modular systems, technological aesthetics, and speculative visual language.

 • Minimalist Typography-First Systems

Type-led identity, hierarchy dominance, spacing control, and editorial logic over illustration.

 • Grunge & Raw Texture Design

Distress, imperfection, analog artifacts, and deliberate erosion of polish.

 • Conceptual & Art-Driven Design

Idea-first visuals, symbolism, reduction, and meaning embedded in form.

 • Campaign-Driven Visual Systems

Seasonal narratives, drop-based art direction, evolving visual arcs, and controlled variation.



?



Application Requirement



Applicants must clearly label which of the above styles are represented in their portfolio and demonstrate intentional, professional execution of each. Superficial or trend-based interpretations will not be considered.





PS:



YOU WILL NEED TO SHOW US VARIOUS WORK ALONG WITH VARIOUS STYLES TO THEN REPRESENT THAT WORK

YOU WILL NEED TO HANDLE MULTIPLE TASKS

YOU WILL NEED TO PREPARE THE WORKS YOU DO FOR US IN A WAY THAT IS IN A WAY WITH WHAT WE DO NOW

YOU WILL NEED TO SHOW US MORE THAN SIMPLE WORKS IE CANVA, SKETCHES, BROCHURES, BASIC ADS DO NOT JUST ATTACH THESE



DESIGNS LIKE

SUPREME

BAPE

KITH

STUSSY

ALD

RED BULL

ARIZONA

LAYS

WARREN LOTAS

VERDY 

VANDY THE PINK

HELLS PARADISE

DOROHEDORO

FLAPJACK

ED EDD AND EDDY

HEY ARNOLD

SPIDERMAN

SUPERMAN

MASCOTS

INDI WORKS

CYBERPUNK

CYBER SIGILISM



PLEASE BE SURE TO INCLUDE SOFTWARES AND OTHER ART PRODUCTS YOU USE IE FIGMA, BLENDER, ADOBE, 

PLEASE BE SURE TO SAY IF YOU DONT DO ANY DIGITAL AND JUST RENDER 

PLEASE BE SURE TO MENTION TO US WHAT IT IS YOU DO 



BE COMFORTABLE WITH ON GOING PROJECTS, REVISIONS, GROUP WORKING, SOLO WORKING, NOTION, GOOGLE DRIVE AND OTHER APPLICATIONS THAT WOULD ALLOW US TO WORK TOGETHER EITHER SOLO OR AS A COLLECTIVE TEAM, WE'VE GOT TEAMS IN ALMOST ALL TIME ZONES SO PLEASE BE AWARE AND RESPECT THAT.



PROJECTS COULD BE A SIMPLE TYPO TO A FULL STORYBOARD, A MINI OUTLINE TO FULL WALL ILLUSTRATIONS



UPON SEEING YOUR WORK BASED ON PROJECTS FULL TIME WILL BE AN OPTION.



THANKS FOR APPLYING.

title: Internal Operations Specialist
description:
We are seeking for an Internal Operations Specialist in the Residential & Commercial Field Services industry.



We are looking for someone highly organized and detail-oriented who can support field operations behind the scenes. In simple terms — you will make sure our crews have the materials, vehicles, tools, systems access, and support they need to do their jobs efficiently.



This role supports services such as pest control, janitorial, pool care, landscaping, and exterior cleaning. If you enjoy managing processes, tracking assets, working with vendors, and keeping operations organized and audit-ready, this role is for you.



What You’ll Really Be Doing:

Purchasing & Materials

Process purchase orders with correct coding and vendor details.

Order and track field supplies (chemicals, cleaning materials, landscaping supplies, PPE, etc.).

Monitor daily spend and help control costs.

Maintain updated vendor lists and pricing.



IT & Asset Support

Coordinate system access for field employees (logins, software, MFA).

Track and issue laptops, tablets, phones, fuel cards, and company cards.

Manage onboarding and offboarding asset recovery.

Help resolve device or access issues by coordinating with IT.



Fleet Management

Help manage company vehicles and equipment using Fleetio and telematics systems.

Track preventive maintenance schedules and ensure compliance.

Monitor registrations, inspections, insurance, and renewals.

Reconcile fleet-related invoices and investigate billing discrepancies.



Finance & Reporting Support

Track CapEx purchases like vehicles, trailers, and equipment.

Monitor lease expirations and send renewal alerts.

Maintain dashboards for fleet utilization, spend per job, and operational KPIs.



Compliance & Process Improvement

Maintain SOPs for purchasing, fleet use, fuel cards, and chemical handling.

Keep documentation audit-ready.

Identify ways to reduce waste, downtime, and unnecessary spending.



What We’re Really Looking For:

5 years of experience supporting field operations, procurement, or fleet management.

Experience in industries like pest control, janitorial, landscaping, pool care, or similar field services.

Hands-on experience with Fleetio or similar fleet management tools.

Strong spreadsheet skills (pivot tables, lookups, data tracking).

Experience managing purchase orders and vendor relationships.

Detail-oriented, organized, and strong follow-through.

Comfortable working with data and dashboards.



Nice to Have:

Experience with Ford Telematics, Emburse, ERP systems (NetSuite or QuickBooks).

Exposure to insurance tracking or lease management.

Basic knowledge of OSHA/EPA guidelines for field operations.



Requirements:

Updated Resume/CV.

Reliable internet connection and personal computer.

Ability to work in a structured, process-driven environment.

Willingness to support multi-site operations across different markets.



Benefits:

Competitive salary based on experience.

Performance-based incentives tied to operational KPIs.

PTO and paid holidays.

HMO for you and your dependents

Opportunity to grow in a systems-driven, high-performance environment.



Join our team now and be part of the top 1% talent in the Philippines!

title: Personal Injury Demand Writer - Legal Assistance
description:
This position will assist the Pre-Litigation Case Manager with case tasks to ensure cases progress efficiently.



This role requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with attorneys, medical providers, and insurance adjusters. The assistant will prioritize drafting demand letters, medical summaries, and gathering essential documents. 



Key Responsibilities & Expectations:

- Maintain detailed notes on client interactions and case status in the case management system.

- Gather, organize, and manage medical records, bills, and other necessary documentation.

- Ensure clients are signing intake documents, HIPAA forms, and other required paperwork.

- Track client medical treatment progress, ensuring proper follow-ups and completion of treatment.

- Coordinate with medical providers to obtain medical records, bills, and treatment updates.

- Draft demand letters

- Work closely with the case manager to ensure efficient progress on cases

- Identify and suggest improvements in procedures and processes to enhance efficiency and organization.



Required Qualifications & Skills:

1+ years (2+ preferred) of experience in personal injury case management, claims handling, or a related legal support role.

Familiarity with medical terminology, billing, and insurance claims processes.

Strong understanding of personal injury law, legal procedures, and case management practices.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with team, medical providers, and insurance adjusters.

High level of organization and attention to detail to manage multiple cases and deadlines.

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.

title: Amazon Operations VA (FBA & OA | Full-Time | EST)
description:
We are an established Amazon Online Arbitrage (OA) business operating in the US marketplace.

This is a long-term, full-time role with clear SOPs, defined responsibilities, and consistent biweekly pay.



What This Role Is



-You will follow clear SOPs

-You will execute defined daily tasks

-You will report work clearly and consistently

-You will work inside a structured Amazon operation



Core Responsibilities



-Product sourcing (Online Arbitrage lead generation)

-Secondary Responsibilities (SOP-Driven)

-Upload sourcing leads into live Google Sheets

-Handle Amazon ungating submissions (templated)

-Create and follow up on reimbursement cases

-Manage returns and refunds (execution only)

-Draft buyer message responses

-Prepare A-to-Z cases for approval

-Handle inauthentic complaints

-Maintain accurate case logs and documentation

Note: Product sourcing is the primary task. All other tasks are secondary and SOP-based.



Requirements (Please Apply Only If You Meet These)

- 1+ years of Amazon Seller Central experience

- Strong experience with Online Arbitrage

- Daily working knowledge of:

- Amazon Seller Central

- Keepa

- Sellerboard

- Google Sheets

-Slack



Hands-on experience with:

-Ungating categories and brands

-FBA operations and reimbursements

-Able to work 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST (night shift in PH)

-Highly detail-oriented and able to follow SOPs exactly





Application Instructions (very important)



(To respect both your time and ours)



We use a short video to avoid long interviews and to identify serious applicants.



Step 1 — Record a Short Video ( no longer than 90 seconds)



Camera on. Answer in order:



1. How do you usually handle ungating categories or brands on Amazon?



2. How do you identify, document, and claim lost or damaged FBA inventory?



3. What Amazon tools do you use daily in your work?



Step 2 — Upload to Google Drive



Create one Google Drive folder containing:



Your video



Your resume (PDF preferred)



Set permissions to “Anyone with the link can view.”



Applications missing the video, answers, or resume will not be reviewed.

title: Acquisitions Closer – Real Estate
description:
Acquisitions Closer – Real Estate 



Are you process-driven, direct, and energized by real conversations?

We’re looking for a disciplined outbound sales professional based in the Philippines to connect with property owners facing urgent, complex situations—delinquent taxes, inherited estates, title issues, and more. Our sellers aren’t just “leads”—they’re people in transition who need straight answers and real solutions.



This is not a basic call center job.

If you’re skilled at asking the right questions, unafraid of hearing “no,” and want your compensation to reflect your results—not just your effort—read on.



Role Overview:



Primary focus: Outbound calling to distressed property owners—cold calls, follow-ups, and active pipeline management.



Objective: Uncover seller motivation, determine property fit, and guide owners to a clear outcome (offers or next steps).



Daily routine: High phone activity, rapid qualification, disciplined follow-up, accurate notes.



Pace: High volume, high accountability. Activity and results are tracked and reviewed.



Compensation Structure:



Base pay: Modest, for reliability.



Commission: Significant; your earnings scale with your results.



No ceiling: Top performers set their own income.



Underperformance: Addressed quickly—excuses are not accepted.



Environment & Expectations:



You control your own pipeline—but are measured daily.



Calls are monitored, results are tracked, and feedback is regular.



If you thrive in a disciplined, no-excuses culture, you’ll succeed here.



If you require micro-management or dislike structure and direct feedback, this will not be a fit.



What We’re Looking For:



Resilience: Can you keep dialing and qualifying, no matter how many rejections?



Clarity: Can you speak directly, ask difficult questions, and move conversations toward a decision?



Self-management: Do you measure your own output and seek improvement—without constant reminders?



Motivation: Are you truly driven by the opportunity to control your income?



Application Instructions – Read Carefully



Voice Recording (Required):

Send a 2–3 minute audio introduction (not read, not AI-generated).

Cover these points, in this order:



Your name and most relevant phone sales experience.



Why you’re a strong fit for conversations with distressed sellers (not just generic sales).



How you organize your workday to maintain consistent output, even when wins are delayed.



What excites you about commission-based earnings.



How you handle feedback and respond to strict accountability.



Applications missing the recording, or not following the format above, will not be considered.

Attach your resume as well.

title: Social Media & Podcast Production Intern
description:
About the Role



Seller Fuel (dba Toy Launch) is hiring a Social Media & Podcast Production Intern to support our content ecosystem across podcasts, social media, and brand channels.



This is a true entry-level internship designed for someone who wants to learn, build real skills, and gain hands-on experience in podcast production, short-form content, and social media execution.



???? No prior experience is required.

???? Training, SOPs, templates, and guidance will be provided.



This role is not for experienced editors or candidates seeking high pay.

This role is for someone hungry to learn, reliable, detail-oriented, and willing to grow.



If you are looking to break into digital marketing, content, or media and want real-world experience inside an agency environment, this role is for you.



Important Compensation Notice (Read Carefully)



Starting pay: $300 USD per month



Full-time internship (40 hours per week)



Performance-based increases possible over time



???? DO NOT APPLY if this compensation does not work for you.

???? Applications asking for higher pay will be automatically rejected.



What You’ll Do

Daily Workflow (approximately 8 hours per day)

Podcast Editing & Basic Production (approximately 2.5 hours per day)



Assist with editing podcast audio and video using provided templates



Trim basic mistakes, pauses, and filler words



Sync audio and video and add intros/outros using SOPs



Export and upload files following step-by-step instructions



Ensure content is clean and professional (not advanced or cinematic editing)



Social Media Content Editing & Repurposing (approximately 2 hours per day)



Help repurpose podcast episodes into short-form videos



Create clips for Instagram Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and LinkedIn



Add captions and basic text overlays using templates



Follow brand styles and instructions exactly



Focus on consistency and accuracy, not creativity freedom



Social Media Execution & Publishing (approximately 2 hours per day)



Schedule and publish posts across assigned social platforms



Follow the content calendar and posting instructions



Ensure captions, hashtags, and formatting are correct



Double-check posts before publishing to avoid mistakes



Post-Podcast Production & Content Management (approximately 1.5 hours per day)



Organize files, folders, and assets in shared drives



Upload completed work to ClickUp



Assist with podcast syndication steps



Support basic blog formatting or uploads when instructed



Communicate quickly if something is unclear or missing



What This Internship Is (and Is Not)



This internship IS:



Entry-level



Training-focused



SOP- and template-driven



A learning opportunity with real production work



This internship is NOT:



A senior or advanced editing role



A creative director position



A freelance gig



A high-paying job



What We’re Looking For



No experience required



Willingness to learn and follow instructions



Strong attention to detail



Reliable and consistent work ethic



Basic computer skills



Comfortable working with repetitive tasks



Good written English communication



Open to feedback and improvement



Bonus (not required):



Interest in social media, podcasts, or digital marketing



Familiarity with Canva, CapCut, or basic video tools



Technical Requirements



PC or Mac



Stable internet connection



Headphones for basic audio review



Ability to manage files and folders



Perks and Growth Opportunity



100% remote



Hands-on agency experience



Training with real SOPs and workflows



Clear growth path to Junior or Full-Time Coordinator roles (based on performance)



Opportunity to learn podcast production, content marketing, and social media systems



About Seller Fuel and Toy Launch



Seller Fuel LLC helps toy and game entrepreneurs launch, grow, and scale brands on Amazon and beyond.



Our in-house brand, LakiKid, supports children with Autism, ADHD, and Sensory Processing Disorder. Our products are used in over 300 locations across the United States, including major sports stadiums, aquariums, and zoos.



We also run podcasts, educational programs, and media initiatives supporting founders worldwide.



How to Apply (Read Carefully)

Step 1



Apply using exactly 7 Apply Points on OnlineJobs.ph.



Step 2



In your first reply, answer all 7 questions below.

Missing answers = automatic rejection.



Why are you interested in this internship?



What do you want to learn from this role?



Do you understand this is a $300/month full-time internship? (Yes/No)



What is your current time zone and daily availability?



Do you have a stable internet connection and computer? (Yes/No)



Have you worked with any content or social media tools before? (Optional)



One fun fact about yourself



Please attach your CV or resume (if available). A portfolio is not required.



Final Reminder



???? DO NOT APPLY if $300/month is too low for you.

We are intentionally starting this as an internship, with growth based on performance.

title: Front End React Developer
description:
Job Overview

---------



As a React developer, you will implement new features and maintain existing code using React and other standard tools in the React ecosystem, such as Next and Yarn.



Your duties will include designing software solutions to meet project requirements, maintaining and refactoring existing code, writing tests, and fixing bugs.



Examples:

Provide advice and document best practices on proper React implementation.

Assist in troubleshooting efforts and resolving script issues.

Mentor frontends and encourage a pursuit of knowledge in all things related to React development.



Responsibilities and Duties:

---------



Maintain existing React systems, including fixing bugs

Design and develop new custom components to meet project requirements

Install and configure server environments for React deployments

Maintain and update project dependencies as well as fix any conflicts

Working with other JavaScript developers and software engineers to develop front-end and back-end architecture that’s well structured and flexible, along with the APIs to support it





Qualifications:
years implementing the major React components.

Possess leadership skills and be able to work as a leader and developer.

Solid understanding of React workflows.

Good communication skills.

Knowledge of React and common tools used in the wider React ecosystem, such as Next, Node.js and yarn

Familiarity with common programming tools such as Redux, IDEs, GraphQL, RESTful APIs, Git repositories, TypeScript, version control software, and remote deployment tools

An understanding of common programming paradigms and fundamental React principles, such as React components, hooks, and the React lifecycle



Technical Qualifications
+ years in frontend development and strong React experience.

Graphic design and user experience background.

Understanding of content organization and concepts within information architecture.

Frontend and standard Internet protocols, cross-browser, XML, HTML, HTTP, XHTML, CSS + preprocessors (SASS/LESS/etc), JavaScript (a.k.a. plain or raw), Ajax, React, Redux, Next or other JS frameworks.

Strong experience with GraphQL and RESTful APIs

Familiarity with basic Magento functionality (API = must)

title: Digital PR & Backlink Authority Specialist
description:

(Finance Niche)

My company is transitioning from a legacy brand into a SaaS business credit infrastructure platform.

Coordinate affiliate link updates

Monitor anchor text distribution



Post-Migration Authority Growth



Secure finance-relevant backlinks



Podcast and founder interview placements



Guest article placements in financial publications



Monitor toxic link risks



Build a consistent referring domain growth strategy

Experience in financial, fintech, or SaaS niches



Demonstrated backlink case studies



Strong outreach and negotiation skills



Understanding of anchor text risk management



Familiarity with Google link quality standards



Success Metrics



Preserve legacy backlink equity



Increase referring domains within 90 days



Improve brand visibility for Brand



Strengthen financial trust signals

Provide one example of a backlink or digital PR campaign you executed in a competitive niche, including results.

Why do SEO migrations fail, and what differentiates a successful one?

title: Technical Support Specialist – Futures Trading Software
description:
Full Job Description

About Us



Zion Trading Algos (ZTA) is a fast-growing algorithmic trading software company serving futures traders and prop firm traders. We help traders use automation to reduce emotional trading, improve discipline, and take a long-term approach to funded accounts.



We provide white-glove onboarding, ongoing support, and a strong 
 community for our clients. As we continue scaling, we are looking for a dedicated Customer Support Specialist to join our team.



Role Overview



We are hiring a full-time Customer Support Specialist to support ZTA clients during EST trading hours (9:30am–5:00pm EST).



This role requires someone who is:



Highly responsive



Technically capable



Calm under pressure



Professional in written and spoken communication



Comfortable on Zoom screenshare calls



You will be the front line of support for traders using our algorithmic systems inside NinjaTrader and on VPS environments.



Key Responsibilities

1. 
 & Ticket Support



Actively monitor 
 during EST trading hours.



Respond to client questions related to:



NinjaTrader setup



Strategy installation and updates



VPS login and configuration



Basic prop firm account setup



Help manage and resolve support tickets.



Escalate complex issues to senior tea
mbers when necessary.



2. Zoom Troubleshooting Calls



Jump on live Zoom calls with clients to:



Screenshare and troubleshoot NinjaTrader issues



Help install or update algorithms



Verify settings are configured correctly



Diagnose common trading platform errors



You must be comfortable guiding clients step-by-step through technical processes.



3. Prop Firm & Trading Platform Support



Assist clients trading with prop firms (Apex, etc.).



Understand common prop firm rules:



Trailing drawdown



Consistency rules



Daily loss limits



Help clients understand how our algorithms function within those constraints.



4. Community Presence



Maintain a professional and calm tone at all times.



Support traders during red days or drawdown periods.



Reinforce long-term thinking and disciplined system usage.



Keep responses clear, structured, and well-written.



Requirements



Required:



Available Monday–Friday, 9:30am–5:00pm EST



Excellent written and spoken English



Strong troubleshooting skills



Comfortable using:







Zoom



Google Docs / Sheets



Strong attention to detail



Calm and patient personality



Preferred (but not required):



Experience with NinjaTrader



Experience with futures trading



Familiarity with prop firms



Experience supporting trading software



Basic understanding of:



VPS environments



Windows troubleshooting



Installing and importing NinjaScript files



We will train the right candidate on our specific systems.



Ideal Candidate



You are:



Organized and proactive



Comfortable dealing with traders who may be frustrated



Able to explain technical concepts clearly



Not easily overwhelmed



Interested in trading, finance, or fintech



Willing to learn continuously



You do not need to be a professional trader. But you must be comfortable learning the basics of futures and algorithmic trading.



Compensation



Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)



Opportunity to grow into a larger Client Success role



Long-term opportunity with a growing fintech company



Performance-based bonuses possible



How to Apply



Please include:



A short introduction about yourself



Your experience with trading platforms (if any)



Your experience with technical support or troubleshooting



Your availability in EST hours



A short Loom video introducing yourself (optional but preferred)

title: Media Buyer (Meta Ads Specialist)
description:
Expert Media Buyer (Meta Ads Specialist)

We are looking for an experienced, results-driven Media Buyer who lives and breathes Meta advertising. This is not an entry-level role. We need someone who understands strategy, creative testing, data interpretation, and scaling — not just someone who can “boost posts.”

If you know how to turn ad spend into measurable revenue, keep reading.

 

About the Role

As our Meta Ads Specialist, you will be responsible for planning, launching, optimizing, and scaling high-performing ad campaigns across
 and Instagram. You will manage budgets strategically, test creatives intelligently, and make data-backed decisions that drive growth.

You should be equally comfortable inside Ads Manager and inside analytics dashboards.

 

Responsibilities

• Build, launch, and manage Meta ad campaigns from strategy to execution

• Conduct audience research and develop targeting strategies

• Create structured testing plans (creative, hooks, angles, audiences)

• Optimize campaigns daily based on performance metrics

• Scale winning campaigns profitably

• Monitor and improve key KPIs (CPL, CPA, ROAS, CTR, CPM, etc.)

• Install and manage Meta Pixel and Conversion API tracking

• Troubleshoot tracking discrepancies and attribution issues

• Analyze funnel performance and provide strategic recommendations

• Produce clear weekly/monthly performance reports

• Collaborate with creative team on high-converting ad concepts

 

Required Experience

• 3+ years of hands-on experience running Meta ad campaigns

• Proven track record of managing $10,000+ monthly ad budgets (higher preferred)

• Experience scaling campaigns to profitable ROAS

• Strong understanding of Meta Ads Manager structure and best practices

• Experience with A/B testing and creative iteration

• Deep knowledge of conversion tracking, pixels, and attribution

• Ability to analyze data and identify optimization opportunities quickly

• Experience working with lead generation 

 

Preferred Experience

• Experience running ads for service-based businesses

• Experience with high-ticket offers

• Familiarity with landing page optimization

• Knowledge of funnel strategy

• Experience using tools like GoHighLevel, Google Analytics, or other CRM platforms

 

What Success Looks Like

• Consistently improving CPA and ROAS

• Clear, proactive communication

• Strategic thinking (not reactive button-pushing)

• Testing mindset with documented learnings

• Data-driven decision making

 

Who This Is NOT For

• Someone who only knows how to boost posts

• Someone who relies on one campaign structure for everything

• Someone who blames performance solely on “the algorithm”

• Someone who needs constant direction

 

Why Join Us?

• Work with growth-focused brands

• Room to scale with performance

• Data-driven culture

• Creative collaboration environment

 

If you’re confident in your ability to turn paid traffic into real revenue, apply with:

1. Your resume

2. Case studies or performance results

3. Monthly budgets you’ve managed

4. Your favorite campaign you’ve ever scaled and why

title: Luxury E-Book Designer & Layout Specialist
description:
I’m looking for a creative and detail-oriented E-book Designer to transform my written content into a visually stunning, professional e-book. The e-book is focused on credit repair, inquiry deletion, and financial empowerment, and I want it to reflect a modern, trendy, and luxury “girl-boss” vibe.



Responsibilities:

Design and format my e-book (20–30 pages).

Create a visually appealing cover page with luxury editorial vibes (black, purple, gold, Vogue/Forbes inspired).

Use my brand colors (deep purple, black, gold, lavender) throughout.

Add stylish headers, icons, and page layouts that look professional and phone-ready.

Ensure the PDF is easy to read and consistent across devices.



Requirements:

Strong experience in graphic design and e-book layout (portfolio required).

Skilled in Canva, Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, or Illustrator.

Ability to match luxury lifestyle and trendy branding aesthetics.

Creative but able to follow my branding direction.

Reliable and able to deliver within 1–2 weeks.



Nice to Have:

Experience working with entrepreneurs, coaches, or financial service brands.

Ability to create additional social media graphics from the e-book content.

description:

Full-Time | US Company | $8/hr + Performance Bonuses

title: Senior B2B Outbound SDR – UK/EU Fleets & International Distributor Development
description:
Senior B2B Outbound SDR – UK, Europe & International Distributor Development



Full-Time | Performance-Based Growth Role



About ShoulderSink



ShoulderSink is a European manufacturer of professional mobile hand hygiene systems used primarily in commercial vehicles. More than 50,000 professionals use our systems across multiple markets. We are a small team and operate strictly B2B and work with fleet customers and national distributors.



We are expanding across the UK, Europe and selected international markets, including relevant markets such as US and Japan.



The Role

This is a performance-driven outbound role focused on building qualified pipeline in:



- UK fleet market

- European fleet customers

- International distributor markets (including US, Japan and other relevant regions)



This is a full-time role designed for long-term growth. Continued development and expanded responsibility are performance-based.



What You Will Do

- Fleet Development (UK & Europe)

-Cold outreach to fleet managers, operations directors and HSE managers

- Identify current hygiene practices in commercial vehicles

- Generate qualified fleet trials

- Secure structured commercial evaluation meetings

- Distributor Development (International)

- Identify and contact national distributors and importers

- Qualify commercial capability and market coverage

- Secure evaluation meetings

- Move prospects to structured next steps



Over time - International Growth Support

- Contribute to market research and expansion strategy

- Support international trade show preparation

- Potential participation in selected international activities based on performance



General Responsibilities

- High-volume outbound outreach (calls + follow-up)

- Structured CRM documentation

- KPI accountability and weekly reporting



What We Expect

- 3+ years outbound B2B experience

- Proven experience calling US or UK decision-makers

- Strong commercial mindset

- Confident objection handling

- CRM discipline

- Clear, professional English



We are not hiring call-center telemarketers. We are hiring a commercially minded outbound professional capable of engaging decision-makers.



Compensation

- $1,600/month base salary

- Commission per qualified fleet trial

- Commission per qualified distributor evaluation

- 5% first-year revenue share on sourced accounts



Total earnings are STRONGLY performance-driven.



Growth Opportunity

This role is structured for long-term development. Increased responsibility, broader international exposure and participation in trade activities are based on measurable results.



Application Requirement

To apply, please include:

- A short written summary of your outbound B2B experience

- A 60-second audio recording introducing yourself and pitching a B2B product

- Applications without an audio introduction will not be reviewed.

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) for a Property Management Company ( Property Management Experience is a MUST )
description:
The CPA will oversee all financial aspects of our property management operations, including accounting, reporting, budgeting, and compliance. This role requires a detail-oriented professional with a deep understanding of real estate accounting, who can provide strategic insights while ensuring accuracy and compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage full-cycle accounting for multiple properties, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger functions

• Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

• Ensure compliance with GAAP, tax regulations, and company policies

• Oversee cash flow management, budgeting, and forecasting

• Reconcile bank accounts and monitor financial transactions

• Work with property managers and leadership to provide financial insights and recommendations

• Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals as needed

• Implement process improvements for efficiency and accuracy



Qualifications

• Active CPA license required

• Property Management Experience is a MUST

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master’s a plus)

• Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, preferably in property management or real estate

• Experience with property management software preferred

• Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills

• Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities

• Detail-oriented, organized, and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment



Tools & Software



Familiarity with the following tools are preferred:



• Yardi



• RealPage



• QuickBooks



• Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail)



• Microsoft Excel

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) for a Property Management Company ( Property Management Experience is a MUST )
description:
The CPA will oversee all financial aspects of our property management operations, including accounting, reporting, budgeting, and compliance. This role requires a detail-oriented professional with a deep understanding of real estate accounting, who can provide strategic insights while ensuring accuracy and compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage full-cycle accounting for multiple properties, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger functions

• Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

• Ensure compliance with GAAP, tax regulations, and company policies

• Oversee cash flow management, budgeting, and forecasting

• Reconcile bank accounts and monitor financial transactions

• Work with property managers and leadership to provide financial insights and recommendations

• Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals as needed

• Implement process improvements for efficiency and accuracy



Qualifications

• Active CPA license required

• Property Management Experience is a MUST

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master’s a plus)

• Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, preferably in property management or real estate

• Experience with property management software preferred

• Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills

• Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities

• Detail-oriented, organized, and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment



Tools & Software



Familiarity with the following tools are preferred:



• Yardi



• RealPage



• QuickBooks



• Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail)



• Microsoft Excel



To apply, please send your application to 
 through OLJ will not be entertained.



As part of our hiring process for the CPA position, we require verification of your active PRC license. Please provide a photo or screenshot of your PRC ID or a PRC verification page showing your name and license status. This information will be used solely for employment verification



Include a short cover letter as well as your resume.



Also include a personalized 2-minute video only introducing yourself and share in the video introduction why you believe you’re a great fit for this role and give one specific example of how you’ve demonstrated attention to detail in your previous CPA work.

title: At-Home Record Retrieval Specialist (USA – HIPAA)
description:
Due to our rapid growth, we are expanding our team and seeking dedicated Work-From-Home Record Retrieval Specialists based in the Philippines. In this role, you will retrieve medical and healthcare-related records for U.S.-based clients, follow up on record requests until completion, and use sound judgment along with our guidance to determine next steps. This is an excellent long-term opportunity for individuals with call-center, telemarketing, or BPO experience who want to grow with a supportive team.



Responsibilities

• Retrieve medical and healthcare records from various providers for U.S. clients.

• Make outbound calls and follow up persistently until requests are completed.

• Provide excellent customer service and maintain professional communication at all times.

• Work 7–8 hours per day, Monday to Friday, aligned with U.S. ET or PT time zones.

• Ensure compliance with HIPAA and all confidentiality requirements



Required Qualifications

• Ability to work U.S. Eastern Time (ET) and/or Pacific Time (PT).

• Prior voice BPO or call-center experience.

• Experience working from home.

• Telemarketing or outbound calling experience.

• Strong verbal and written English communication skills.

• Problem-solving mindset and ability to work independently.

• Dedicated home office with high-speed internet.

• USB headset required.

• Ability to maintain strict confidentiality.

• Entrepreneurial, self-driven work attitude.

• Must pass a criminal background check.

• Experience in healthcare or legal fields is a plus.



What We Offer

• Personalized business training program.

• Opportunity for growth—we promote from within!

• Flexible working hours within required U.S. shifts.

• Friendly, supportive team environment.

• Bi-weekly payments.



We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Applications are accepted only through our HR site:

title: Senior Facebook & Google Ads Manager (Real Estate & E-Commerce)
description:
**Job Title: Senior
 & Google Ads Manager (Real Estate & E-Commerce)**

Location: Remote | Part-Time or Full-Time (Performance-Based Preferred)



**About the Role**

We are seeking an experienced and results-driven
 and Google Ads Manager to lead paid advertising campaigns for two growing brands: a luxury real estate business in South Florida and an emerging clothing brand. This role requires strategic thinking, creative testing, strong analytical skills, and proven experience generating qualified leads and profitable ROAS.



**Key Responsibilities**



* Plan, create, launch, and manage paid campaigns across Meta 
/Instagram) and Google Ads (Search, Display, YouTube).

* Develop full-funnel strategies for lead generation (real estate) and conversions (e-commerce apparel).

* Conduct audience research, keyword research, competitor analysis, and ongoing A/B testing.

* Build and optimize landing pages and conversion tracking (Pixel, GA4, Tag Manager).

* Continuously monitor KPIs: CPL, CPA, ROAS, CTR, conversion rate, quality score, etc.

* Scale winning campaigns and systematically eliminate underperforming ads.

* Provide weekly performance reports with clear insights and action steps.

* Collaborate with content and creative teams for high-converting ad creatives.



**Qualifications**



* Minimum 3+ years of hands-on experience managing Meta and Google Ads.

* Proven results in real estate lead generation and/or e-commerce sales campaigns.

* Strong understanding of conversion tracking, retargeting strategies, and funnel optimization.

* Experience managing monthly ad budgets of $5,000+.

* Data-driven mindset with the ability to interpret performance metrics and pivot quickly.

* Strong communication skills and ability to present strategy clearly.



**Preferred**



* Experience working with luxury brands.

* Familiarity with CRM integrations and lead automation systems.

* Understanding of local real estate markets and consumer buying behavior.



Competitive pay based on experience, plus performance incentives tied to lead quality and ROAS.



If you are strategic, analytical, creative, and performance-focused — and can demonstrate measurable results — we would like to speak with you.



Please apply with case studies, screenshots of past campaign results, and a brief explanation of your testing and scaling strategy.

title: Marketing Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation Focus) - JAS
description:
Marketing Operations Support Virtual Assistant (Lead Generation Focus)



Full-Time | Remote | Contract-Based



I’m looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Marketing Operations Support Virtual Assistant with strong lead generation and marketing support experience. This role is critical to supporting day-to-day marketing operations, improving lead flow, and keeping systems running smoothly. You’ll work closely with leadership and the project manager and directly support core growth activities.



This is not a Personal Assistant or Executive Assistant role. It’s a hands-on marketing ops + lead gen support position.



Role Overview



Your primary responsibility will be lead generation through Upwork and LinkedIn, supported by structured workflows, AI-assisted processes, and clear performance targets. You’ll also assist with light backend operations, reporting, and content ideation using documented systems.



Once trained, you’re expected to work independently, think critically, and execute with consistency.



Key Responsibilities (Summary)



1. Upwork Lead Generation (Top Priority)



Monitor Upwork for relevant opportunities aligned with target client profiles



Draft and submit high-quality proposals using provided templates and brand voice



Use AI tools to personalize proposals efficiently (not copy-paste)



Track proposal performance and provide weekly insights on results



2. LinkedIn Engagement & Lead Support



Post thoughtful, AI-assisted comments daily using curated content feeds



Review and refine AI-generated drafts to maintain an authentic voice



Track engagement trends and submit weekly summaries



3. Lead Data Management & Reporting



Clean, verify, and maintain lead data in Google Sheets



Complete follow-up and performance reports with zero missing fields



Flag data or quality issues immediately



4. AI-Assisted Content Ideation (Light Task)



Review shared articles and videos via Slack



Extract insights using guided AI prompts



Create content idea outlines using provided templates



5. Backend Operations Support



Manage personal tasks in the project management system



Provide light operational and workflow support as needed



Tools You’ll Use



Upwork (essential)



LinkedIn



AI Tools: ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity



Google Workspace: Google Sheets, Docs, Gmail, Calendar



Slack



Motion (or similar task/project management tool)



Required Skills & Experience



Minimum of 3 years proven work experience as a Virtual Assistant supporting marketing agencies or B2B service-based companies



Hands-on experience in lead generation, marketing operations, and workflow support



Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think through processes and resolve issues independently



Advanced comfort using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity) for drafting, research, and productivity



Ability to follow documented processes precisely while understanding the purpose behind each workflow



Excellent written English with professional grammar and communication skills



Extremely detail-oriented with high accuracy in data entry, reporting, and submissions



Self-directed work style; able to execute independently after training



Reliable internet connection and professional remote work setup



What Makes You a Strong Fit



You troubleshoot instead of stalling when something isn’t clear



You use AI strategically, not blindly



You notice patterns and suggest small process improvements



You communicate proactively and flag issues early



You value consistency, accuracy, and accountability



Application Requirements (Important)



To be considered, please submit all of the following:



Updated Resume / CV



Portfolio (if applicable to marketing, lead gen, or ops work)



2-minute self-introduction video explaining your experience and why you’re a good fit for this Marketing Operations & Lead Gen VA role



Applications missing any of the above will not be prioritized.

title: Account Executive Graphic Design Agency UAE

Nice to Have

Why Work With Me

How to Apply

Send me the following:

• Your availability

title: VIDEO/IMAGE EDITOR
description:
About Us

We’re a fast-growing e-commerce company running multiple dropshipping brands across Poland and other European markets. We sell digital products targeted at men and women aged 35+.

New products and brands can launch at any time — so there’s always something new to work on and improve.



The Role

We’re looking for a full-time Video/image Editor who specializes in creating scroll-stopping, authentic UGC-style video ads for Meta.

You’ll work closely with our team — we provide scripts, creative concepts, and access to our content library. Your job is to turn these ideas into high-converting ads that feel real, natural, and engaging.



What You’ll Be Creating

AI UGC ads (30–60 seconds) – testimonial style, “someone recommending a product they genuinely love”





Mini VSLs (1–2 minutes)



Images





Iterations of winning creatives





Multiple hooks per concept (we typically test 3 hooks + 1 shared body per concept)

Your Responsibilities

Edit 2–3 high-quality ad concepts per day (quality over quantity — we prefer 4 strong ads over 6 average ones)





Source additional footage online when needed to match the script





Add captions/subtitles to all videos





Select fitting background music





Generate AI voiceovers using ElevenLabs





Create AI UGC avatars using HeyGen and Veo

Requirements

Experience editing UGC-style ads for e-commerce (even a few months is fine if your work is strong)





Proficiency with AI tools: HeyGen, Veo, ElevenLabs (required)





Strong understanding of what makes content feel authentic and scroll-stopping





Ability to source visuals and create cohesive ads where footage matches the script





Communicative to advanced English





Reliable, self-motivated, and able to work independently







Nice to Have

Experience working with Polish-language ads (not required, but a plus)







What We Offer

$900–1,000 USD/month (depending on experience)





Full-time position (8 hours/day, flexible schedule — no need to overlap with European time zone)





Access to all necessary subscriptions: HeyGen, Veo, ElevenLabs, and any new tools that help us create better ads





Long-term collaboration — grow with us as we scale





Clear path toward becoming a Creative Strategist as we expand the team





Opportunity to deepen your AI-driven content creation skills







How to Apply

Reach out to us and we’ll send you a test task:

You’ll receive an ad concept with a script and create 2 short videos — 2 different hooks with 1 shared body.

This will allow us to evaluate your editing skills, creativity, and style.

title: Graphic Design Assistant
description:
Job Highlights – Marketing Virtual Assistant

This role supports our real estate marketing team by executing and maintaining templated brand assets with precision, speed, and consistency. This position is about operational excellence, brand alignment, and fast-turnaround support using established templates and systems.



Core Responsibilities

Graphic Production & Editing

-Populate and deliver templated graphics (e.g., Just Listed, Just Sold, Open House, Agent Welcome, Sign Riders) using Canva.

-Complete templated business cards and signage requests.

-Edit backgrounds from agent headshots as needed.

-Fill in recurring templated marketing assets based on agent milestones and brokerage needs.



Complete agent-submitted requests such as:

-Pulling addresses for circle prospecting.

-Skip tracing contact information for outreach.

-Assist with new agent welcome materials, signage, and social media graphics.



Workflow Execution

-Maintain and update agent data via Airtable to ensure accurate branding assets.

-Use Google Drive to organize and deliver final graphics.

-Track all tasks and due dates via Asana to ensure nothing falls through the cracks.



Tools You’ll Use Daily

Canva – To complete templated graphics with brand consistency.



Google Drive – For asset storage and delivery.



Airtable – To retrieve and update agent details tied to each task.



Asana – For managing all incoming and ongoing tasks.



Everhour - For tracking time & recording screenshots



Ideal Candidate Skills

Fast, accurate template editing (no custom design).



Sharp eye for visual consistency and detail.



Strong organizational skills with the ability to juggle multiple agent requests.



Familiarity with real estate marketing (a plus, not required).



Responsive, proactive communicator—especially in asynchronous environments.

title: Sales VA
description:
We are hiring a Sales-Oriented Virtual Assistant who knows how to confidently handle

objections and close deals over the phone. You’ll be the first point of contact for leads

interested in our U.S.-based cleaning services, and your main goal is to convert those inquiries

into paying customers.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in sales conversations, knows how to build trust

quickly, and doesn’t shy away from tough questions or hesitations from prospects.



Key Responsibilities:

- Take inbound sales calls from interested leads and follow up with outbound calls when

needed

- Confidently pitch our services and walk customers through pricing and packages

- Handle common objections (pricing, scheduling, trust concerns) with professionalism

and ease

- Convert warm leads into scheduled jobs with a consistent close rate

- Manage CRM updates, lead tracking, and post-call notes

- Assist with scheduling, follow-up
s, and basic administrative tasks

- Maintain excellent customer service before, during, and after the sale



What We're Looking For:

- Fluent in English with strong conversational skills

- Proven ability to overcome objections and close sales on calls

- Comfortable talking to U.S. customers and building rapport quickly

- Detail-oriented with solid administrative follow-through

- Able to work independently and take initiative without constant supervision

- Experience with cleaning or home services (preferred but not required)



Technical Requirements:

- Minimum 30 Mbps wired Internet connection

- Quiet, professional work environment with no background noise

- Backup Internet and device for emergencies

Compensation & Hours:

- $5–$5.50 per hour (depending on experience)

- Full-time role

- Must be available during U.S. business hours (Pacific time)

- Commission's available as bonuses for top performers

- Bonuses provided for hitting key KPI's

- Looking for someone who wants to grow with the growth of the organization.



To Apply:

Submit a short voice or video message describing your experience with handling objections

and closing sales over the phone. Real examples or metrics from past roles are a plus. As well as why you would be a good fit for our company
